Title: Data Analyst I
Description:
Data Analyst I – Geospatial & Competitive Insights

We are seeking a Data Analyst to perform geospatial and competitive bid analysis, providing insights that inform strategic decision-making. This role involves analyzing bid locations, creating summary statistics, and developing dashboards to track performance metrics. You will work with geospatial datasets, automation scripts, and state-specific formatting requirements to produce accurate, actionable outputs for the business.

The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, experience in Python scripting, and proficiency in Excel, with SQL knowledge as a plus. Attention to detail, adaptability, and the ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders are essential.

Key Responsibilities


Conduct map-based analysis to inform bidding strategies, including data review, Python scripting, and statistical summaries.
Analyze locations bid and won, including competitive bid trends and insights.
Combine geospatial data with reference tables to create meaningful, actionable reports.
Design and maintain dashboards/visualizations for BEAD location statistics.
Generate specification files using automated scripts, ensuring compliance with state-required formatting standards.


Top Required Skills


Analytical & Modeling Skills – Ability to perform data analysis, create forecasts, and solve business problems using structured approaches.
Python – Basic scripting for automation, data transformation, and analysis.
Excel – Proficiency in advanced formulas, pivot tables, and data organization.


Skills & Experience Required


Undergraduate degree in business, finance, engineering, or a related field (Graduate degree preferred).
0–3 years of experience in data analysis, business forecasting, or a related role.
Experience in building and managing financial models for forecasting and variance analysis.
Basic Python knowledge; SQL experience preferred.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Highly detail-oriented, with the ability to prioritize and adapt in a dynamic environment.


Work Environment & Structure


Collaborative team environment with opportunities to work independently on analytical projects.
Mix of technical analysis, reporting, and stakeholder communication.
Exposure to high-impact strategic initiatives through data-driven decision-making.


Why This Role?

This position offers the opportunity to combine geospatial analysis, automation, and strategic insight to directly influence competitive positioning. You will gain hands-on experience in data analytics, visualization, and business strategy in a dynamic and evolving industry.

JW1

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Department: Studio Research & Analytics

Reporting to: Manager, Business Intelligence & Analytics

Job Summary:

Are you curious, creative, and love data? Do you enjoy collaborating with colleagues and using data to drive actionable insights? Do you want to be on the cutting edge of breakthroughs in data and analytics, encouraged to discover, challenged to think bigger, and supported to learn new things personally and professionally?

The Walt Disney Studios seeks an Associate Data Analyst to join the Studio Research & Analytics team. The Digital Analytics team is a highly visible department that is charged with finding the best methods to understand consumer thoughts, feelings, and behaviors across digital and social channels. They play an integral part in aiding key business decisions for Disney+, Hulu, and Studio brands; including Disney, Pixar, Marvel, Lucasfilm, and 20th Century Studios. You will join a dynamic group who love movies and television and are passionate about bringing the consumer voice into studio decision-making every day.

You will play a crucial role in supporting the team’s ability to analyze and interpret data related to our digital marketing efforts through routine review and metadata application on owned and earned social media content. You will collaborate with a team of Data Analysts to provide valuable insights to drive informed business decisions. This role requires strong attention to detail, proficiency in content management tools, experience with large-volume data sets, and a deep understanding of digital and social media platforms.

Responsibilities:



Review and evaluate content published to the Studio’s network of social channels across Facebook, Instagram, X/Twitter, TikTok and YouTube on a daily basis against established reporting guidelines
Apply comprehensive data labeling to owned and earned social posts, including user-generated content, within a content tagging management system, building and leveraging automated functions such as macros when appropriate. Liaise with external platform partners to streamline workflows or resolve platform bugs when needed
Support the Digital Analytics team in the preparation and execution of digital reports, ranging from recurring digital performance reports to ad-hoc issues management and alerts support, for our major Studio brands and titles
Perform quantitative data pulls and analysis for reporting deliverables across various digital channels by tapping into various toolsets
Develop prototype solutions, including reports and dashboards, to support insights with visualization of complex data sets
Collaborate with internal teams and communicate performance results in a clear and concise manner to a variety of stakeholders



Basic Qualifications:



Some relevant work experience or internship experience required
Familiarity with content management systems (Sprinklr, RivalIQ)
Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint) and Google Drive (Sheets/Slides) systems
Exceptional organizational skills, with a relentless attention to detail
Exceptional time management skills, with an ability to work rapidly and efficiently in a fast-paced and changing environment
Effective written and verbal communication skills, with an ability to adapt communication styles to suit different audiences
Strong analytical thinking and mathematical skills
This role requires in-person collaboration from Monday to Thursday and remote work on Friday



Preferred Qualifications:



1 year of experience in data analytics with experience in entertainment, digital marketing, social media, or consumer data
Familiarity with social listening tools (Quid, ListenFirst)
Familiarity with social media analytics provided by Facebook, Instagram, Threads, X/Twitter, TikTok, and YouTube
Familiarity with website analytics tools (Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics)



Education:



Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Marketing, Psychology, or a related quantitative field



The hiring range for this position in California is $64,300.00 to $86,200.00 per year. The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. A bonus and/or long-term incentive units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to the full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered.

Title: Analyst, Insights & Reporting
Description:
About Sony Music Entertainment

At Sony Music Entertainment, we fuel the creative journey. We’ve played a pioneering role in music history, from the first-ever music label to the invention of the flat disc record. We’ve nurtured some of music’s most iconic artists and produced some of the most influential recordings of all time.

Today, we work in more than 70 countries, supporting a diverse roster of international superstars, developing and independent artists, and visionary creators. From our position at the intersection of music, entertainment, and technology, we bring imagination and expertise to the newest products and platforms, embrace new business models, employ breakthrough tools, and provide powerful insights that help our artists push creative boundaries and reach new audiences. In everything we do, we’re committed to artistic integrity, transparency, and entrepreneurship.

Sony Music Entertainment is a member of the Sony family of global companies.

The Analyst - Podcast provides insightful and strategic reporting to the Global Podcast Division across both the US + UK. This is a great opportunity for a data-savvy candidate to support Sony Music’s efforts in podcasting.

The role is responsible for leveraging a suite of internal and 3rd party tools to generate reporting and strategic insights across SME’s global podcast division. The role combines performance reporting, audience insights and ad hoc duties to drive data-driven decision making. The Analyst will generate data-driven recommendations for diverse set of teams spanning creative, marketing, ad sales + executive leadership, ultimately translating the actionable insights into presentation format. The candidate will be part of Sony Music’s podcast team in New York and will report into the VP, Insights & Reporting.

What you'll do:


Provide detailed weekly reports on show/episode performance, charting, + engagement metrics across the entire slate and key podcast titles to inform real-time decision making.
Generate insight around existing + future audiences for our podcasts, leveraging multiple data sources across analytics + research. This includes designing + analyzing listener surveys for direct feedback from core audiences.
Create deep-dive analyses or research studies to help refine audience targets, marketing, + ad sales, as well as evaluate future editorial decisions (e.g. talent conversations, creative concepts, etc).
Prepare regular mid or post campaign analyses for key titles, identifying areas of success and optimization across creative and marketing.
Respond to a large volume of ad-hoc data + analytics requests in a timely manner across multiple teams to support show marketing + sales efforts


Who you are:


Minimum 2-3 years experience in analytics, market/consumer research, media/entertainment research, audience development or related field
Possess a strong knowledge and passion for podcasts is a must.
Comfortable with various coding, survey research, visualization + data software programs/tools, such as Excel, PowerPoint, SQL, Python, Tableau, Looker social analytics platforms, survey design/analytics tools (e.g. Qualtrics, GWI, Brandwatch, Tubular, etc)
Know how to tell a compelling story from data in a clear + concise manner – orally, in writing, and in visual presentations.
Are an effective communicator, with excellent verbal + written communication skills
Have great organizational skills + are comfortable handling multiple projects simultaneously with efficiency & speed, working well under tight deadlines.
Degree with a concentration in Analytics / Psychology / Marketing / Consumer Behavior preferred (or equivalent work experience)


What we give you:


You join an inclusive, collaborative and global community where you have the opportunity to channel your passion every day
A modern office environment designed to foster productivity, creativity, and teamwork empowering you to bring your best
An attractive and comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, life & disability coverage, and 401K + employer matching
Voluntary benefits like company-paid identity theft protection and resources for pets, mental health and meditation resources, industry-leading fertility coverage, fully paid leave for childbirth or bonding, fully paid leave for caregivers, programs for loved ones with developmental disabilities and neurodiversity, subsidized back-up child and elder care, and reimbursement for adoption, surrogacy, tuition, and student loans
Investment in your professional growth and development enabling you to thrive in our vibrant community.
The space to accelerate progress, positively disrupt, and create what happens next
Time off for a winter recess


Sony Music is committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all persons regardless of age, disability, national origin, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, veteran or military status, marital and civil partnership/union status, alienage or citizenship status, creed, genetic information or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

The anticipated annual base salary does not include any other compensation components or other benefits that an individual may be eligible for. The actual base salary offered depends on a variety of factors, which may include as applicable, the qualifications of the individual applicant for the position, years of relevant experience, specific and unique skills, level of education attained, certifications or other professional licenses held, and the location in which the applicant lives and/or from which they will be performing the job.

New York Pay Range

$64,000—$70,000 USD

Title: Data Analyst I: 25-05915
Description:
Primary Skills: SQL (Expert), Advanced Excel (Proficient), Data Visualization (Intermediate), Python (Intermediate), Data Analysis (Proficient)

Contract Type: W2 only

Duration: 5+ Months with possibility of extension

Location: Bellevue, WA ()

Pay Range: $35-$42 per hour

#LP

Job Summary

This position focuses on analyzing map and location data for strategic decision-making, involves running Python scripts for data analysis, and requires creating visualizations and automated specification files. The role demands strong analytical skills to support business forecasting and problem-solving. The candidate will work independently, requiring attention to detail and the capability to manage financial models efficiently.

Key Responsibilities


Perform map analysis for bidding strategies using Python scripts and creating summary statistics.
Analyze locations bid and won, providing insights into competitive bids.
Perform analysis on location and geospatial data, combining them with reference tables.
Create dashboards/visualizations for BEAD locations statistics.
Generate specification files using automation scripts according to state-required formatting.


Must-Have Skills


1-3 years of experience in SQL and MS Excel.
Ability to create and manage visualizations using Tableau or QuickSight
Knowledge of basic Python


Industry Experience Required


Experience in finance, business, engineering, or related fields is preferred.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the Role

We are seeking a Data Analyst with strong experience in data automation, dashboard development, and analytics reporting. In this role, you’ll work closely with executives and leadership to deliver accurate, actionable insights through dashboard creation, data auditing, and process automation. You will play a key role in transitioning manual reporting into an automated, scalable solution using Alteryx and modern BI tools.




Key Responsibilities

Respond to ad hoc reporting requests from executives and senior leadership.
Develop, maintain, and audit dashboards in Tableau or Power BI to ensure data accuracy and relevance.
Audit and correct existing dashboards to align with accurate data sources and KPIs.
Design and build Alteryx workflows to automate ETL (extract, transform, load) processes.
Cleanse, normalize, and prepare data for reporting and analytics.
Work with stakeholders to define KPIs and develop metrics dashboards.
Assist in implementing an automated reporting process using Alteryx Server and Snowflake.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate new data sources and improve reporting efficiency.




Required Qualifications

Proven experience with Alteryx Designer for data automation, cleansing, and ETL processes.
Ability to build workflows that extract, transform, and load data from multiple sources.
Experience with Power BI or Tableau for dashboard development and visualization.
Strong data cleansing, normalization, and KPI development skills.
Experience working directly with stakeholders to fulfill ad hoc reporting requests.




Preferred Qualifications

Experience with Looker for BI reporting.
Familiarity with Alteryx Server for automated reporting distribution.
Experience with Snowflake as a data warehouse platform.




Preferred Qualifications

Medical and prescription coverage
Basic life insurance, 401(k) with company match
Employee Assistance Program
Employee discounts on vehicle purchases, parts, and service
PTO
Supplemental benefit plans including dental, disability, supplemental life insurance, and legal services
Opportunities for career advancement

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (Part-Time, Remote)

Company: Raymond James

Location: Remote (U.S. based)

Employment Type: Part-Time

At Raymond James, we combine deep market insight with a commitment to client success. We’re looking for a Part-Time Remote Data Analyst to join our team and help us transform raw data into actionable insights that drive smarter decisions. This is an ideal opportunity for someone who thrives on problem-solving, loves working with data, and values flexibility.

What You’ll Do

Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets from multiple sources.
Build and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to track business performance.
Identify patterns, trends, and anomalies to support strategic decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and provide insights.
Ensure accuracy, consistency, and integrity in all data reporting.

What We’re Looking For

2+ years of experience in data analysis, preferably in financial services or a related field.
Strong skills in SQL, Excel, and at least one data visualization tool (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable recommendations.
High attention to detail and strong organizational skills.
Self-starter who can work independently and meet deadlines in a remote setting.

Nice to Have

Familiarity with Python or R for data analysis.
Understanding of financial markets, investment products, or wealth management.

Why You’ll Love Working Here

Flexible, part-time schedule (approx. 20 hours/week).
100% remote work – contribute from wherever you are.
Opportunity to work with a respected name in the financial industry.
Collaborative and supportive work environment.

If you’re passionate about making data work harder and smarter, we’d love to hear from you.

How to Apply

Apply directly through LinkedIn or submit your resume via the Raymond James careers site.

Title: Data Analyst - People Analytics
Description:
Data Analysts in People Analytics drive the business by empowering HR, Recruiting, and business leaders to incorporate people insights into workforce and business decisions. In this role, you will create analysis with people data, create dashboards for scaled solutions and efficient reporting, and develop materials for leaders of the company to drive strategy. You will partner with People Analytics teams to influence priorities, perform research, and build solutions for the future. The People Data Analyst is the link between the business and complex data requirements that cannot be accessed through self solve channels. We are currently looking for Data Analysts who are interested in finding the right data to solve business challenges while recognizing opportunities to build new functionally and improve existing systems. We are looking for someone who enjoys building, figuring out the best way to achieve results, and working closely with teams across Meta to solve complex problems.

Data Analyst - People Analytics Responsibilities:


Act as an internal consultant and partner to HR, Recruiting, and business leaders and engage with the broader analytics community to deliver insights, research and scalable solutions
Apply expertise in data analytics to identify business relevant insights and develop executive level presentations to influence people strategy
Recognize patterns and changing requirements to identify opportunities to build new analytics and reporting capabilities to support program evaluation and operations
Focus on impact and propose metrics to understand success of People initiatives
Manage multiple concurrent projects that require inputs from cross-functional stakeholders while balancing impact on business needs
Deliver analytical findings to company leadership
Leverage data analysis tools, such as Python, R, SQL, Tableau, and spreadsheets to develop models, understand trends, and extract insights
Demonstrate judgment and discretion when dealing with highly sensitive people data
Intake on business needs and apply contextual knowledge in order to scope data requests, synthesize insights, and recommend solutions to key business partners in collaboration with others
Proactively manage stakeholder expectations, manage escalations and resolve issues in a timely manner


Minimum Qualifications:


BA/BS in Engineering, Industrial Psychology, Data Science, or related field with 5+ years (or MBA/MA/MS with 4+ years or PhD and 3+ years) experience in fields such as analytics, management consulting, sales operations, finance, compensation, or related areas
4+ years of data analysis, quantitative/qualitative research, experience gathering and evaluating data and validating hypotheses
3+ years of experience working with SQL or relational database, data modeling, and advanced querying
3+ years of experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Visier, MS PBI, Qlik, SAS VA, etc.)
3+ years of storytelling with data, communicating technical results to technical and non-technical audiences
2+ years of experience with program management, directing tasks and managing multiple streams of work


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience working with HR/organizational people data (e.g., headcount, turnover, recruiting metrics)
Experience working across various levels of an organization, while building trust and fostering collaboration
2+ years of dashboard development using advanced Tableau functionality (e.g. data blending)
3+ years of experience SQL and data pipeline development and automation
3+ years of experience with Python or R and developing solutions that scale


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

$104,000/year to $146,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

$104,000/year to $146,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

🏢 Company: Aaratech Inc

🛑 Eligibility: Only U.S. Citizens and Green Card holders are eligible.

Please note that we do not offer visa sponsorship.

Job Summary:

Aaratech Inc. is seeking a highly analytical and detail-driven Data Analyst to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for transforming raw data into actionable insights that influence strategic decisions and improve operational performance. If you enjoy working with large data sets, creating impactful visualizations, and collaborating across departments — we want to hear from you!

Key Responsibilities:

🔹 Data Collection & Management

Gather, clean, and organize data from various internal and external sources.
Ensure accuracy, consistency, and integrity of datasets.

🔹 Data Analysis

Analyze large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Support decision-making through statistical analysis and forecasting.

🔹 Reporting & Visualization

Design and build dashboards and reports using Tableau, Power BI, or similar tools.
Present data-driven findings in a clear, concise manner to stakeholders.

🔹 Team Collaboration

Work with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver tailored analytics solutions.

🔹 Tool Utilization

Leverage tools like SQL, Excel, and BI platforms for analysis and reporting.

🔹 Data Governance

Contribute to the implementation of data governance and best practices for long-term data integrity.

Qualifications:

✅ Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field

✅ Minimum of 2 years of experience in a data analysis or similar role

✅ Proficiency in SQL and Microsoft Excel

✅ Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI

✅ Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking abilities

✅ Excellent written and verbal communication skills

✅ Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders

Title: AVP, Data Analyst (Visualization, Python)
Description:
Job Description

Jefferies Financial Group Inc. (‘‘Jefferies,’’ ‘‘we,’’ ‘‘us’’ or ‘‘our’’) is a U.S.-headquartered global full service, integrated investment banking and securities firm. Our largest subsidiary, Jefferies LLC, a U.S. broker-dealer, was founded in the U.S. in 1962 and our first international operating subsidiary, Jefferies International Limited, a U.K. broker-dealer, was established in the U.K. in 1986. Our strategy focuses on continuing to build out our investment banking effort, enhancing our capital markets businesses and further developing our asset management platform. We offer deep sector expertise across a full range of products and services in investment banking, equities, fixed income, asset and wealth management in the Americas, Europe and the Middle East and Asia.

We are seeking a Data Analyst with a strong foundation in Data Science to help drive data-driven decision-making. The ideal candidate will have expertise in data analysis, statistical modeling, machine learning, and data visualization to extract actionable insights from complex datasets.

Key Responsibilities:


Collect, clean, and preprocess data from various sources.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to identify trends and patterns.
Develop and implement predictive models and machine learning algorithms.
Create data visualizations and dashboards to communicate insights effectively.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and provide data-driven solutions.
Ensure data integrity, security, and compliance with relevant regulations.
Stay updated with the latest data science techniques and industry trends.


Required Skills & Qualifications:


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proficiency in Python, R, SQL
Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms, statistical analysis, and data mining techniques.
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to translate business needs into data-driven solutions.
Prior experience in Capital Markets is highly preferred.


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience with deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Knowledge of Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Time Series Analysis.
Familiarity with ETL processes and data pipeline automation.


The salary range for this position is $100,000-$150,000

About Us

Jefferies Financial Group Inc. (‘‘Jefferies,’’ ‘‘we,’’ ‘‘us’’ or ‘‘our’’) is a U.S.-headquartered global full service, integrated investment banking and securities firm. Our largest subsidiary, Jefferies LLC, a U.S. broker-dealer, was founded in the U.S. in 1962 and our first international operating subsidiary, Jefferies International Limited, a U.K. broker-dealer, was established in the U.K. in 1986. Our strategy focuses on continuing to build out our investment banking effort, enhancing our capital markets businesses and further developing our Leucadia Asset Management alternative asset management platform. We offer deep sector expertise across a full range of products and services in investment banking, equities, fixed income, asset and wealth management in the Americas, Europe and the Middle East and Asia.

At Jefferies, we are committed to building a culture that provides opportunities for all employees regardless of our differences and supports a workforce that is reflective of the communities where we work and live. As a result, we are able to pool our collective insights and intelligence to provide fresh and innovative thinking for our clients.

Jefferies is committed to creating and sustaining a workforce that welcomes individuals from all backgrounds to apply. Our employment decisions are made without regard to race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, religion, pregnancy, age, medical condition, physical or mental disability, marital status, domestic partner status, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, genetic information, reproductive health decisions, or any other factor protected by applicable law. We are committed to hiring the most qualified applicants and complying with all federal, state, and local equal employment opportunity laws. As part of this commitment, Jefferies will extend reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities, as required by applicable law.

The salary offered will take into consideration an individual’s experience level and qualifications. In addition to salary, Jefferies Financial Group is proud to offer a comprehensive benefits package to eligible, full-time employees or part-time employees, who are scheduled to work at least 30 hours or more per week, including an annual discretionary incentive and retention bonus, competitive employee benefits, including: medical, dental & vision coverage; 401(k); life, accident, and disability insurance; and wellness programs. Jefferies also offers paid time off packages that include planned time off (e.g., vacation), unplanned time off (e.g., sick leave), and paid holidays, and for full time employees, paid parental leave.

Title: Data Analyst - Digital Services
Description:
Data Analyst – Digital Services (Education & Family Entertainment)

Location: Hybrid – 3 days/week in Soho, NYC

Pay Rate: $48/hour

Hours: 35–40 hours/week, ongoing contract

Duration: Ongoing contract (start ASAP)

Note: Must be eligible to work in the U.S. – No sponsorship or C2C




About the Role

My client, a leader in the education and family entertainment space, is seeking a Data Analyst to join their Digital Services team on an ongoing contract basis. This hybrid role will have you in their Soho NYC office three days a week, working closely with marketing, operations, and product partners to analyze data, generate actionable insights, and support digital initiatives that directly impact the customer experience.




Key Responsibilities

Collect, clean, and interpret large datasets to drive decisions across digital and business operations.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to track KPIs.
Analyze digital campaign performance, customer engagement data, and key product usage metrics.
Present findings clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity across systems.




Qualifications

2–4 years of data analysis experience (digital, marketing, or consumer-facing industries preferred).
Strong skills in Excel, SQL, and data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, Looker, etc.).
Proven ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Strong communication and presentation skills.




Why You’ll Love It

Join a creative, high-energy Digital Services team making a tangible impact on the customer journey.
Hybrid schedule in vibrant Soho with flexibility for the right candidate.
Ongoing contract with a respected leader in education & entertainment.

Title: Sr. Data Analyst
Description:
The Sr. Data Analyst at St. Mary’s Food Bank is a strategic role focused on building a modern, scalable data environment. This individual will lead enterprise data architecture efforts, transform and model data for a new ERP implementation (NetSuite), and play a key role in integrating and leveraging NetSuite Analytics Warehouse (NSAW).

This role will work cross-functionally to design our future data landscape, prepare systems for long-term growth, and drive transformation through analysis, visualization, and data-informed insights. The successful candidate will also supervise future data team members and must demonstrate initiative, leadership, and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively.

Essential Functions


Design and implement scalable, sustainable enterprise data architecture in alignment with organizational goals.
Lead data transformation and migration processes for the NetSuite ERP system, including data modeling and mapping between legacy and new systems.
Build ETL/ELT pipelines for structured and unstructured data from a variety of sources (internal and external).
Creating clear and effective data visualizations and dashboards to communicate insights to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Collaborate with departments to define reporting requirements, KPIs, and data standards.
Conduct statistical and trend analysis to guide decision-making and program evaluation.
Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and governance across systems.
Advise the organization on data and analytics best practices and stay informed of emerging technologies and industry trends to ensure continuous improvement.
Work closely with leadership to drive strategic insights and improve operational efficiency.
Other duties as assigned by leadership.


Performs all functions according to established policies, procedures, regulatory and accreditation requirements, as well as applicable professional standards. Provides all internal/external customers of St. Mary’s Food Bank with an excellent service experience.

Scope and Complexity

May interact with all levels of leadership, employees, agency representatives, community neighbors, volunteers, external vendors, and clients.

Physical Demands/Environment Factors


Requires extensive sitting with periodic standing and walking.
May be required to lift up to 20 pounds.
Requires significant use of personal computer, phone and general office equipment.
Needs adequate visual acuity, ability to grasp and handle objects.
Needs ability to communicate effectively through reading, writing, and speaking in person or on telephone.
May require off-site travel; possible out-of-state travel


Minimum Qualifications


A bachelor's or master’s degree in a related field (e.g., data science, statistics, computer science) or the equivalent in directly related experience.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
5+ years of experience in a data analyst or analytics role.
Familiarity with statistical software and data visualization tools (e.g., Excel, Tableau, Power BI).
Experience with data modeling and warehousing: Understanding of data structures and database management.
Advanced SQL skills and experience with ETL/ELT tools (e.g., dbt, Fivetran, Talend, or similar).
Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively.
Ability to take initiative and work independently to establish and manage work priorities, activities and timelines to achieve results.
Exhibit strong attention to detail.
Ability to think creatively and come up with solutions.
Ability to critically review, summarize, and report findings and recommendations.
Ability to work in a fast-paced team environment.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience working in the Oracle NetSuite System and NetSuite Analytics Warehouse (NSAW)
Leadership experience and building and motivating a team
Data governance experience
ERP implementation experience
Experience in a non-profit or social service setting is beneficial


What We Offer


Competitive Compensation Package:
Competitive Pay starting at $100,000.00, annually, including:
401(k) Retirement Savings Plan with a generous employer match
Employee Referral Bonus Program
Tuition Assistance
Comprehensive Benefits:
Medical and Insurance Coverage
An employee-only medical plan at no cost to you
4 low-cost employee-only, spouse and/or family member medical plans
Vision and Dental coverage
Health Savings Account generously funded by the employer and Flexible Spending Account options
Short- and Long-Term Disability, Life and Accidental Death & Accident Insurance at no cost to you.
Employee Assistance and Wellness Programs
Optional Pet Insurance and Legal Shield Identity Theft offering
Time Off
15 PTO days, accrued bi-weekly, that increases with length of service
40 hours of Personal/Sick time
8 Company Paid Holidays

This is your chance to join a cohesive and welcoming team and make a difference in our Arizona communities. Join our Mission to alleviate hunger.

Qualified candidates are invited to submit their resume to: https://https://www.stmarysfoodbank.org/careers/

St. Mary’s Food Bank is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or other protected status under all applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are excited in your interest to join DC Health (The District of Columbia Department of Health), a nationally accredited Public Health Department (https://phaboard.org/). DC Health is focused on providing the essential public health services (10 Essential Public Health Services) necessary to protect and promote the health of all people in all communities and remove systemic and structural barriers that have resulted in health inequities through the Core Competencies for Public Health Professionals (PH Core Competencies.)

Skills

Come see where your knowledge, skills and abilities are appreciated, developed, and rewarded as you play a vital role in DC Health achieving its Strategic Priorities:


Promote a culture of health and wellness
Address the social determinants of health
Strengthen public-private partnerships
Close the chasm between clinical medicine and public health and
Implement data driven and outcome-oriented approaches to program and policy development.


Bring your professional career to Washington, D.C., the most dynamic and diverse city in the country. With its proximity to major museums, world class parks, entertainment, and restaurants, increasing job opportunities and the seat of the federal government, the District of Columbia continues to be ranked in the top 10 of thriving city indicators where you can live, work and play. We look forward to reviewing your candidacy, be well and good luck!

Job Summary

This position is located in the District of Columbia Government (District), DC Health (DOH), Center for Policy, Planning, and Evaluation (CPPE), Health Informatics Program/Division of Health Information Systems (HIS). The incumbent will serve as a Data Analyst under the purview of the Health Informatics Program Manager. The incumbent manages data products within DOH health systems and supports their integration across federal and local partner systems. They oversee software platforms that enable maintenance, visualization, and dissemination. Furthermore, the incumbent analyzes, recommends, and implements enterprise data solutions to support the modernization of health systems.

Major Duties And Responsibilities

In this role, the incumbent will support the Division of Health Information Systems by transforming data from public health information systems into actionable insights through the development of dashboards, recurring reports, ad hoc reports, and data validation tools. They will be responsible for producing and maintaining reports on program-level and up to agency-wide HIS data; supporting data quality initiatives by developing completeness and validation metrics; and promoting system transparency through the maintenance of the HIS data dictionary and system-specific data catalogs.

The analyst will contribute to system performance monitoring, support the development of reports and dashboards for key performance indicators (KPIs), and complete activities related to grant deliverables, including the visualization of performance measures and metrics aligned with grant reporting requirements. They will also recommend improvements to data structures and reporting processes that enhance accuracy, interoperability, and efficiency. They will work closely with the Informatics Manager to present findings, communicate trends, and identify system-level opportunities. The role will also support onboarding and training by developing materials that strengthen programs capacity and ensure data consistency across programs.

Qualifications And Education

Required Qualifications: Ind

ividuals must possess at least one (1) year of specialized experience that is equivalent to at least the next lower in the normal line of progression for the occupation in the organization. Specialized experience is defined as experience that is typically in or related to the work of the position to be filled, and has equipped you with the particular knowledge, skills, and abilities to successfully perform the duties of the position, and that is typically in or related to the work of the position to be filled.

Master’s level degree in Public Health, Epidemiology, or Statistics is preferred. This degree must be from an educational program from an accrediting body recognized by the U.S. Department of Education(external link) at the time the degree was obtained.

Licenses and Certifications

None required.

Working Conditions / Environment

The incumbent must be able to carry out official duties in a variety of settings and conditions. Routine work will occur primarily in an office setting.

Other Significant Facts

Salary Range: $92,656.00 - $101,290.00

Agency-Wide Consideration: Qualified individuals who submit applications for this vacancy may be considered for other current open vacancies for which they qualify within DC Health.

Tour of Duty: Monday - Friday 8:15am - 4:45pm

Area of Consideration: Open to the Public

Promotion Potential: No Known Promotion Potential

Duration of Appointment: Career Service – Term Appointment: 13 Month time limited

Pay Plan, Series and Grade: CS-0301-12

Collective Bargaining Unit (Union): This position is covered in a collective bargaining unit, represented by Local AFGE 2978

Position Designation

Position Designation: This position has been designated as Security Sensitive. Pursuant to section 410 of Chapter 4 of the D.C. Personnel Regulations; in addition to the general suitability screening, individuals applying for or occupying security sensitive positions are subject to the following checks and tests:


Criminal background check.
Traffic record check (as applicable).
Consumer credit check (as applicable).
Reasonable suspicion drug and alcohol test; and
Post-accident or incident drug and alcohol test.


Residency Requirement

If the position you are applying for is in the Career, Management Supervisory, or Educational Service at an annual salary of one hundred fifty thousand dollars ($150,000) or more, you must establish residency in the District of Columbia within one hundred eighty (180) days of the effective date of the appointment and continue to maintain residency within the District of Columbia throughout the duration of the appointment.

EEO Statement

The District of Columbia Government is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, personal appearance, sexual orientation, family responsibilities, matriculation, physical handicap, or political affiliation.

HTML:
We are excited in your interest to join DC Health (The District of Columbia Department of Health), a nationally accredited Public Health Department (https://phaboard.org/). DC Health is focused on providing the essential public health services (10 Essential Public Health Services) necessary to protect and promote the health of all people in all communities and remove systemic and structural barriers that have resulted in health inequities through the Core Competencies for Public Health Professionals (PH Core Competencies.)

Skills

Come see where your knowledge, skills and abilities are appreciated, developed, and rewarded as you play a vital role in DC Health achieving its Strategic Priorities:

  • Promote a culture of health and wellness
  • Address the social determinants of health
  • Strengthen public-private partnerships
  • Close the chasm between clinical medicine and public health and
  • Implement data driven and outcome-oriented approaches to program and policy development.

Bring your professional career to Washington, D.C., the most dynamic and diverse city in the country. With its proximity to major museums, world class parks, entertainment, and restaurants, increasing job opportunities and the seat of the federal government, the District of Columbia continues to be ranked in the top 10 of thriving city indicators where you can live, work and play. We look forward to reviewing your candidacy, be well and good luck!

Title: Data Analyst I
Description:
What You'll Do:

A Data Analyst on the Retailer Analytics team is a key player in understanding every aspect of Criteo’s complex Retail Media business. This role interfaces across the organization to answer challenging analytical questions related to the performance and growth of Criteo’s Retail Media solutions. The person occupying this position will have an exceptionally broad view of every aspect of Criteo’s business with a focus on Americas Retailers (Supply side). The scope involves both technically rigorous work, including the use leading-edge data analysis technologies, and daily interaction with other cross-functional business units across Commercial, Technical and Product teams, as well as our retailers.

Criteo’s high-growth business model brings both opportunities and challenges. This position involves dealing with a considerable amount of complex, real-world data and requires a candidate who is comfortable thinking of new and innovative ways to analyze data, solve problems, and think strategically. The ideal candidate can function with minimal oversight and has a strong ability to learn new concepts quickly.


Collaborate with Partner Success and Technical Solutions teams to drive retailer growth and increase performance through data-driven insights
Conduct ad hoc analyses for top Americas Retailers to identify revenue driving opportunities like inventory expansion, yield optimization, integration and tech improvements, rate card management, second-price auctions, ad rendering studies, etc.
Proactively identify and collect analytical, tooling and reporting needs from Commercial stakeholders (Partner Success Management and Technical Solutions teams); develop self-service tools to answer these needs using Tableau, Python or any other relevant technologies
Provide retailer or industry insights and present as appropriate to internal teams throughout the organization and to retailers when relevant
Develop intimate understanding of retailers’ goals and needs, and partner with them and our internal commercial teams to formulate strategies for achieving joint objectives
Maintain deep knowledge of Criteo Retail Media products, technologies, and position in the marketplace



Who You Are:


Native-level English fluency
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Computer Science etc.)
Minimum 2 years full-time, analytics-relevant work experience – experience in the digital industry is preferred
SQL proficiency is required
Background in any of the following is a plus: Tableau, Vertica, Hive/Hadoop, Python
Keen intellectual curiosity and ability to structure & solve difficult problems with minimal supervision
Passion for translating ‘data-speak’ into relevant, compelling stories
Exceptional attention to detail coupled with an ability to see the big picture
Thorough conceptual and practical understanding of relational databases, data architecture/governance, and real-world application of statistical concepts
Effective presentation and public speaking skills with the ability to present and defend complex analysis both internally and externally to both technical and non-technical audiences.
A passion for story telling with data!
Must have the combination of technical skills, passion for learning, and the soft skills to work with all personality types in a dynamic environment



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is a leader in commerce media, helping brands, agencies, and publishers create meaningful consumer connections through AI-powered advertising solutions. We’re shaping a more open and sustainable digital future for advertising.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices across the globe or from the comfort of home, our 3,600 Criteos collaborate together to build an open, impactful, and forward-thinking environment.

We foster a workplace where everyone is valued, and employment decisions are based solely on skills, qualifications, and business needs—never on non-job-related factors or legally protected characteristics.

What We Offer:

🏠 Own your work style – Build your work around your life and not the other way around.

📈 Grow with us – Learning, mentorship & career development programs.

💪 Your wellbeing matters – Health benefits, wellness perks & mental health support.

🤝 A team that cares – Diverse, inclusive, and globally connected.

💸 Fair pay & perks – Competitive salary, equity, performance-based rewards and family-friendly policies.

Additional benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo.

For employees based in the US, certain roles at Criteo are eligible for additional rewards, including quarterly or annual bonus and restricted stock units. US-based employees receive access to healthcare, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, family forming and wellness benefits, Flexible Work financial support, learning opportunities, and a robust annual leave plan including volunteer time off and summer vacation days.

The US base salary pay range for this position per year is:

$75,000 - $80,000
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

🏢 Company: Aaratech Inc

🛑 Eligibility: Only U.S. Citizens and Green Card holders are eligible.

Please note that we do not offer visa sponsorship.




Job Summary:

Aaratech Inc. is seeking a highly analytical and detail-driven Data Analyst to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for transforming raw data into actionable insights that influence strategic decisions and improve operational performance. If you enjoy working with large data sets, creating impactful visualizations, and collaborating across departments — we want to hear from you!

Key Responsibilities:

🔹 Data Collection & Management

Gather, clean, and organize data from various internal and external sources.
Ensure accuracy, consistency, and integrity of datasets.

🔹 Data Analysis

Analyze large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Support decision-making through statistical analysis and forecasting.

🔹 Reporting & Visualization

Design and build dashboards and reports using Tableau, Power BI, or similar tools.
Present data-driven findings in a clear, concise manner to stakeholders.

🔹 Team Collaboration

Work with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver tailored analytics solutions.

🔹 Tool Utilization

Leverage tools like SQL, Excel, and BI platforms for analysis and reporting.

🔹 Data Governance

Contribute to the implementation of data governance and best practices for long-term data integrity.

Qualifications:

✅ Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field

✅ Minimum of 2 years of experience in a data analysis or similar role

✅ Proficiency in SQL and Microsoft Excel

✅ Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI

✅ Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking abilities

✅ Excellent written and verbal communication skills

✅ Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
REQUIREMENTS:

US Citizen, Greencard, OPT-EAD (no sponsorship needed)
No C2C, C2H, Corp to Corp
Has Marketing or Digital Marketing Experience
3–5 years of experience in data analytics, business analytics, marketing operations and/or creative operations.







Data Analyst – Marketing & Creative Operations

Location: Orlando, FL

Department: Data Analytics / Agency Operations

Reports to: Assistant Director, Agency Operations




About the Role: We’re looking for a highly analytical and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join the Operations team within the in-house creative agency. This role will focus on transforming operational and project data into actionable insights, with a strong emphasis on Power BI dashboards and executive-level reporting. The ideal candidate will also have a solid understanding of project management workflows and be comfortable collaborating with cross functional teams in a creative environment.




Key Responsibilities:

* Overall

• You will have room to run with ideas, and the trust to execute. That trust is built on how you show up: thinking things through, sweating the details, and following through.

• Your ability to work independently and unblock others: How well you can move projects forward on your own, and how you help teammates overcome data challenges or confusion.

• 5+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field, with a track record of delivering analytics solutions (dashboards, reports, and data models) from concept to insight.

• Proficiency in Power BI: hands-on experience building interactive dashboards and reports.

• You can create effective data visualizations and have strong DAX skills for custom measures and calculations.

• You think critically about what the numbers are showing and why.

• You take pride in delivering work that is correct and reliable.

• Unique combination of technology and people skills.

• You can dive into technical data problems but also excel at collaborating with others.

• You communicate complex data concepts in clear, approachable terms and build trust with clients and team members alike.

• Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills, paired with a hands-on, proactive attitude.

• You can document your work, write clear explanations, and present findings or recommendations to stakeholders confidently.

• You’ll help cultivate a thoughtful, kind, and continuously learning team culture. Data Analyst




* Data Analytics & Insights

• You’ll gather requirements from stakeholders and translate business needs into interactive reports that drive decision-making.

• Expect to iterate on designs and refine visuals to tell clear data stories

• Perform Data Modeling & Analytics: Develop robust data models and analytical workflows to support reporting and deeper analysis.

• This includes shaping and transforming data (using Power Query, SQL, or Python) to ensure reliable, analyzable datasets.

• You’ll define relationships, calculations, and measures (DAX) that yield accurate insights.

• Partner with Stakeholders: Work directly with clients and team members to understand key business questions and KPIs.

• Throughout the full project lifecycle, you’ll translate business needs into data solutions.

• You will explain your analyses and dashboards clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring insights are understood and actionable

• Ensure Data Quality and Integrity: Take ownership of data accuracy end-to-end.

• You’ll validate and test data, troubleshoot discrepancies, and implement checks so that every report is trusted.

• Maintain documentation of data definitions and assumptions.

• At every step, uphold best practices for data governance and security.

• Optimize and Iterate: Continuously improve the performance and usability of our analytics solutions.

• You’ll optimize SQL queries and Power BI data models for efficiency, ensuring quick load times and up-to-date data.

• Incorporate feedback from users to enhance functionality and refine metrics as needs evolve. • Contribute to Data Strategy: Look beyond immediate requests to identify new opportunities where data can add value.

• You might research emerging BI features, propose new analytics methodologies, or develop internal tools to push our data capabilities forward.

• We expect you to think strategically about how to leverage data for maximum impact.

• Improve Yourself and the Team: During times you’re not assigned to a client project, you won’t be idle.

• You might build internal analytics tools, research new technologies or techniques (e.g., a new Azure analytics service or Python library), or help with recruiting and mentoring. • You’ll help push our data craft and capabilities forward.

• Mentor and Share Knowledge: Lead by example in fostering a data-driven culture.




* Data Visualization

• Design and Build Dashboards: Create and maintain insightful, visually compelling dashboards and reports in Power BI, PowerPoint, and Excel.

• Present findings in a clear, concise manner to stakeholders.

• Translate complex data into actionable insights for business decisions.

• Build and maintain interactive dashboards using Power BI to track KPIs, resource utilization, and project timelines.

• Translate data into compelling visual stories that inform creative and strategic decisions and provide high-level insights for senior leadership.




* Operations & Project Management Support

• Identify trends, gaps, and opportunities to improve marketing and creative processes.

• Lead in shaping and transforming data (using Power Query, SQL, or Python) to ensure reliable, analyzable datasets.

• Collaborate with project management and operations teams to understand data needs and improve reporting processes.

• Support resource planning and capacity forecasting using Epicflow, identifying opportunities to create efficiencies in project execution.

• Help standardize reporting and improve visibility into overall project health and team performance.

• Present findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.

• Support the project management team with data-driven insights and occasional operational assistance.




* Cross-Functional Collaboration

• Highly detail-oriented, self-motivated, organized, and adaptable.

• Work closely with project management, creative, and operations teams to align data insights with business goals and inputs on creative execution.

• Collaborate with IT, other business units, and internal teams to coordinate and execute User Acceptance Testing (UAT) plans for Workfront, Power BI, and Epicflow platforms.

• Act as a bridge between technical data systems and non-technical stakeholders.




Qualifications:

• 3–5 years of experience in data analytics, business analytics, marketing operations and/or creative operations.

• Sufficient experience with Power BI and strong data visualization skills.

• Experience with Workfront and Epicflow (or similar project/resource management tools).

• Advanced skills in Excel, PowerPoint and Word are required.

• Thorough understanding of creative team operations and project management.

• Excellent interpersonal, written and oral communication and storytelling abilities.

• An ability to combine technical expertise with business acumen and communication skills to design, develop and communicate solutions to complex business problems is required.

• Ability to remain adaptable and flexible, to work under pressure, and to maintain productivity in fast-paced operational and creative environments.

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to present to management.




Preferred:

• Experience in a creative agency or in-house brand/marketing team.

• Understanding of creative and production workflows and timelines.

• Bachelor’s or master’s degree in data science, statistics, computer science, marketing or a related field.

• Advanced Power Query, SQL, or Python skills: able to write and optimize complex queries to manipulate and retrieve data from relational databases.

• Experience with Python for data analysis or automation - you can use libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy) to clean, analyze, or augment data, and script repetitive tasks to streamline workflows.

• High proficiency in Excel: adept in advanced formulas, pivot tables, and data analysis in spreadsheets for quick ad-hoc analysis or data modeling when needed.

• Relevant certifications such as Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst Associate or Azure Data Engineer/Analyst certifications

Show more

• You’ll validate and test data, troubleshoot discrepancies, and implement checks so that every report is trusted.

• Maintain documentation of data definitions and assumptions.

• At every step, uphold best practices for data governance and security.

• Optimize and Iterate: Continuously improve the performance and usability of our analytics solutions.

• You’ll optimize SQL queries and Power BI data models for efficiency, ensuring quick load times and up-to-date data.

• Incorporate feedback from users to enhance functionality and refine metrics as needs evolve. • Contribute to Data Strategy: Look beyond immediate requests to identify new opportunities where data can add value.

• You might research emerging BI features, propose new analytics methodologies, or develop internal tools to push our data capabilities forward.

• We expect you to think strategically about how to leverage data for maximum impact.

• Improve Yourself and the Team: During times you’re not assigned to a client project, you won’t be idle.

• You might build internal analytics tools, research new technologies or techniques (e.g., a new Azure analytics service or Python library), or help with recruiting and mentoring. • You’ll help push our data craft and capabilities forward.

• Mentor and Share Knowledge: Lead by example in fostering a data-driven culture.


* Data Visualization

• Design and Build Dashboards: Create and maintain insightful, visually compelling dashboards and reports in Power BI, PowerPoint, and Excel.

• Present findings in a clear, concise manner to stakeholders.

• Translate complex data into actionable insights for business decisions.

• Build and maintain interactive dashboards using Power BI to track KPIs, resource utilization, and project timelines.

• Translate data into compelling visual stories that inform creative and strategic decisions and provide high-level insights for senior leadership.


* Operations & Project Management Support

• Identify trends, gaps, and opportunities to improve marketing and creative processes.

• Lead in shaping and transforming data (using Power Query, SQL, or Python) to ensure reliable, analyzable datasets.

• Collaborate with project management and operations teams to understand data needs and improve reporting processes.

• Support resource planning and capacity forecasting using Epicflow, identifying opportunities to create efficiencies in project execution.

• Help standardize reporting and improve visibility into overall project health and team performance.

• Present findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.

• Support the project management team with data-driven insights and occasional operational assistance.


* Cross-Functional Collaboration

• Highly detail-oriented, self-motivated, organized, and adaptable.

• Work closely with project management, creative, and operations teams to align data insights with business goals and inputs on creative execution.

• Collaborate with IT, other business units, and internal teams to coordinate and execute User Acceptance Testing (UAT) plans for Workfront, Power BI, and Epicflow platforms.

• Act as a bridge between technical data systems and non-technical stakeholders.


Qualifications:

• 3–5 years of experience in data analytics, business analytics, marketing operations and/or creative operations.

• Sufficient experience with Power BI and strong data visualization skills.

• Experience with Workfront and Epicflow (or similar project/resource management tools).

• Advanced skills in Excel, PowerPoint and Word are required.

• Thorough understanding of creative team operations and project management.

• Excellent interpersonal, written and oral communication and storytelling abilities.

• An ability to combine technical expertise with business acumen and communication skills to design, develop and communicate solutions to complex business problems is required.

• Ability to remain adaptable and flexible, to work under pressure, and to maintain productivity in fast-paced operational and creative environments.

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to present to management.


Preferred:

• Experience in a creative agency or in-house brand/marketing team.

• Understanding of creative and production workflows and timelines.

• Bachelor’s or master’s degree in data science, statistics, computer science, marketing or a related field.

• Advanced Power Query, SQL, or Python skills: able to write and optimize complex queries to manipulate and retrieve data from relational databases.

• Experience with Python for data analysis or automation - you can use libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy) to clean, analyze, or augment data, and script repetitive tasks to streamline workflows.

• High proficiency in Excel: adept in advanced formulas, pivot tables, and data analysis in spreadsheets for quick ad-hoc analysis or data modeling when needed.

• Relevant certifications such as Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst Associate or Azure Data Engineer/Analyst certifications

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Pacific Executive Search has been engaged on a search for a CRE Data and Analytics Engineer with DevOps Experience. In this role, you will take on new responsibilities in designing and optimizing data solutions for commercial real estate lending, all while collaborating with cross-functional teams in the vibrant South Bay area. You can expect significant opportunities for career growth as you enhance your technical skills and contribute to innovative financial modeling and analytics initiatives.




Responsibilities:




Data Engineering & Analytics:
Develop and sustain sophisticated underwriting models, cash flow projections, and fund/portfolio analyses utilizing Excel (VBA, Power Query), SQL, and Python.
Create and manage efficient data pipelines, ETL processes, and integrations within Microsoft Azure and SQL Server to handle loan, asset, portfolio, and fund-level data.
Design and oversee Tableau dashboards and Excel reporting tools to provide real-time insights into CRE assets, portfolio performance, and credit risk.
Establish best practices for data quality, security, and compliance, ensuring the integrity and reliability of financial and operational data.
Workflow Automation & Application Development:
Develop automated workflows for underwriting, portfolio/fund modeling, and risk evaluation to minimize manual tasks and enhance accuracy.
Create internal web applications and APIs using Python, JSON, Power Apps, n8n, and other low-code/AI platforms.
Consolidate financial modeling and reporting by integrating data from third-party CRE platforms, loan servicing systems, CRMs, and fund accounting tools.
DevOps & Infrastructure:
Establish and maintain continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD) workflows (Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions) for reliable, test-driven releases.
Utilize Docker/Kubernetes for secure and scalable deployment of analytics applications and data services.
Employ Terraform/ARM templates or similar tools for efficient provisioning and management of Azure resources.
Adhere to strict data security protocols, including encryption, access control, and compliance measures for sensitive financial information.
Cross-Functional Collaboration:
Collaborate with underwriters, asset/fund managers, and risk teams to convert CRE and fund-modeling needs into technical solutions.
Deliver complex analytics, forecasts, and recommendations regarding underwriting decisions, portfolio performance, fund returns, and credit risk to business leaders.
Stay updated on emerging trends in AI, ML, and automation that can improve fund modeling, real estate analytics, and operational efficiency.




Qualifications:




Technical Expertise:
In-depth knowledge of CRE lending, fund/portfolio modeling, and advanced financial modeling techniques.
Advanced proficiency in MS Azure (Data Factory, SQL DB), SQL, Tableau, Excel (VBA, Power Query), ETL processes, and data modeling.
Proven experience in programming with Python, JSON, JavaScript, Git/GitHub, VS Code, and low-code AI frameworks for application development.
Practical experience with CI/CD, containerization (Docker/Kubernetes), and infrastructure-as-code (Terraform/ARM templates).
Soft Skills & Business Acumen:
Capability to interpret intricate CRE and fund modeling requirements, aligning technical solutions with financial strategies and performance goals.
Excellent communication skills for conveying technical concepts to cross-functional teams (finance, credit, operations).
Self-motivated with the ability to manage multiple projects in a dynamic environment.
Preferred Experience:
Familiarity with CRE loan servicing systems, underwriting software, or asset/fund management platforms.
Experience in credit risk modeling, fund performance analysis, or structured finance.
Knowledge of CRM automation, alternative lending technologies, and advanced CRE data sources.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Alliance Animal Health is a fast-growing Veterinarian Service Organization that operates as a majority owner and business partner to many veterinarian practices across the US. Our goal is to make it easier for our practices at every step by providing world-class business solutions like talent acquisition, marketing, human resources, finance, and operations, so that they can focus their energy on providing incredible care for animals. In fact, our Core Values are (quite literally) written with PETS in mind: Passion, Engagement, Trust and Service.

We want our doctor partners to choose what's best for their practice because they are the experts in medicine, while we customize the support, the co-ownership approach, and business solutions based on their goals. We pride ourselves on maintaining a culture of open communication and collaboration to deliver innovative solutions to advance today’s veterinary environment - without disrupting the medical autonomy and what makes each of our hospitals unique. Because at the end of the day, our central support team exists to serve our practices. So, if you’re excited about using your talents to make an impact on the health and wellness of pets - we’d love to talk with you!

This is a remote role, but you must be comfortable working EST time zone.

Job Description

We are seeking a curious, collaborative, and technically skilled Data Analyst to join our Analytics team. Reporting to the Data Analytics Manager, you will play a key role in creating, automating, and scaling reporting infrastructure across Alliance Animal Health. Your work will directly support leadership, operations, and clinical teams with actionable insights to drive performance and growth.

You’ll be working with data stored in our Amazon S3 data warehouse and will be responsible for designing, managing, and enhancing our Tableau ecosystem. You should be fluent in SQL and Excel, experienced with Python for data transformation, and confident building compelling dashboards that bring data to life.

The ideal candidate has experience across the entire data ecosystem from a data warehouse to marketing channels to ad hoc reports. He or she will thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment with a no-job-too-big or small attitude. He or she will have a mix of inquisitiveness, learning agility, emotional intelligence, and drive for success. This individual will work closely with stakeholders across the organization to develop our key reports that generate invaluable business insights.

Responsibilities


Work with the Data Analytics manager to develop, automate, and scale reports and dashboards using data from our Redshift warehouse
Own and manage the Tableau ecosystem, including dashboard creation, data source management, and administrative governance
Write complex SQL queries to extract, clean, and analyze large datasets
Use Python for data wrangling, automation, and exploratory analysis as needed
Collaborate with stakeholders across departments to understand data needs and deliver impactful solutions
Support ongoing reporting needs for key departments such as operations, marketing, strategy, and finance
Ensure data integrity, consistency, and accuracy across all reporting tools
Identify and implement process improvements and automation opportunities
Document data definitions, processes, and technical solutions for team knowledge-sharing


Qualifications


2–4 years of experience in a data analyst, business intelligence, or similar role
Strong proficiency in SQL and Excel (pivot tables, lookups, data modeling)
Proficient in Python for data analysis, automation, or scripting
Advanced Tableau skills—able to build complex, interactive dashboards and manage multiple data sources
Experience working with cloud-based data warehouses (S3, Redshift, Snowflake, etc.)
Strong communication skills with the ability to translate data insights into business recommendations
Detail-oriented with a commitment to data accuracy and clarity
Experience in a multi-unit environment a plus


Additional Information

WE ARE A DRUG-FREE, SMOKE-FREE, EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER.

Company Policy & Federal & State Laws Forbid Discrimination Because of Age, Color, Race, Religion, Sex, Disability, Sexual Orientation or National Origin
Show more
