Title: Data Analyst (DAX)
Description:
On behalf of our client in the manufacturing sector, we are seeking an experienced Data Analyst, with expertise in compliance monitoring, audit, or fraud detection in market placement, environmental schemes, or similar data-centric regulatory environments.




The Data Analyst will play a central role in supporting the effective administration and oversight of confidential data. The primary responsibility is to coordinate market placement declarations, ensure accurate and timely data reporting by producers/distributors, monitor the integrity of submissions, and enhance business intelligence (BI) capabilities throughout the organisation. The successful candidate will be instrumental in mitigating non-compliance risks, detecting under-reporting, and driving initiatives to automate compliance and reporting processes.




Responsibilities:




Market Placement Declaration Coordination: Oversee the end-to-end process of platform availability and user access for market placement data entry, ensuring all designated parties (producers/importers) have access, promptly addressing technical or process-related issues, dispatching reminders, and actively following up on late, missing, or inconsistent submissions.




Market Surveillance & Data Verification: Design, implement, and execute comprehensive market surveillance protocols, including data auditing, reconciliation, and cross-verification of reported declarations to detect anomalies, under-declarations, and inconsistencies.




Fraud Detection & Analytical Modelling: Develop, refine, and maintain data-driven tools and machine learning models for fraud detection, anomaly spotting, and pattern recognition within large datasets to identify irregularities indicative of non-compliance or fraudulent activities.




Reporting, Business Intelligence & Automation: Lead the preparation of analytical reports, compliance dashboards, and ad hoc analyses for internal and regulatory purposes. Automate recurring reporting and data processing tasks via coding and advanced BI tools to drive process efficiency and accuracy.




Stakeholder Communication & Collaboration: Serve as a point of contact with the regulatory authority, ensuring timely and accurate exchange of relevant compliance data. Liaise with internal teams (including operations, IT, compliance, and management) to support investigation of irregularities, resolve issues, and communicate analytical findings.




Requirements:




Demonstrated proficiency in business intelligence tools (e.g., Power BI, DAX) for building interactive dashboards, data models, and management reports.
Applied experience in machine learning techniques and data analytics for the purposes of fraud detection, anomaly detection, or compliance monitoring.
Proficiency in programming/scripting languages for process automation and data manipulation.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office suite, especially for data analysis and presentation.
Prior experience in a customer-facing or stakeholder management function, with strong communication skills and a proactive attitude.
Educational background in a relevant field such as Data Science, Business Analytics, Statistics, Economics, or Computer Science.




Desirable:




Experience in compliance monitoring, audit, or fraud detection in market placement, environmental schemes, or similar data-centric regulatory environments.
Previous exposure to regulatory data submissions, market surveillance, compliance assurance, or related regulatory programmes.
Familiarity with the operational aspects of Extended Producer Responsibility (EPR) frameworks.




Personal Attributes:




Analytical mindset with acute attention to detail.
Proactive problem-solver able to work creatively and independently and as part of a cross-functional team.
Strong organisational skills; able to balance multiple priorities and deadlines.
High ethical standards and commitment to data integrity, compliance, and non disclosure.

Show more

Title: JUNIOR DATA ANALYST - GIACOMO MILANO
Description:
Giacomo Milano nasce dal talento visionario e dalla passione per la buona cucina di Giacomo Bulleri, che nel 1958 fonda la Trattoria Da Giacomo, prima insegna di un Gruppo che oggi ne conta 10 tra ristoranti, botteghe e caffè.

Luoghi unici, ambienti raffinati che accolgono gli ospiti in un salotto, dove farsi coccolare con piatti della tradizione culinaria italiana, preparati con materie prime d’eccellenza.

Per la nostra sede stiamo cercando un* Junior Data Analyst da inserire nel team Finance, con l’obiettivo di supportare l’analisi dei costi e contribuire, con metodo e visione, al miglioramento continuo delle nostre performance.

Sarai parte di un team che lavora con precisione, passione e spirito collaborativo, a stretto contatto con colleghi e reparti diversi, per costruire ogni giorno un sistema solido, efficiente e trasparente.

Di cosa ti occuperai:


Supporterai la raccolta e l’aggiornamento dei dati economici dai sistemi gestionali
Collaborerai con il team Finance per generare report e analisi su costi, volumi e tempi
Creerai dashboard per monitorare KPI chiave (saving, tempi di consegna, efficienza operativa)
Lavorerai a stretto contatto con altri reparti per integrare dati e informazioni
Parteciperai alla produzione di analisi ad hoc per la direzione e le funzioni coinvolte



Chi stiamo cercando:


Hai una laurea in Economia, Ingegneria gestionale, Statistica o affini
Ti muovi con agilità su Excel e strumenti di analisi dati (Power BI, Google Sheets…)
Hai un occhio attento ai numeri e alle sfumature
Ti piace ragionare, capire, collegare
Sei curios* del mondo della ristorazione, dei suoi ritmi e delle sue logiche
Lavorare in squadra per te è naturale, e la comunicazione è uno dei tuoi punti di forza



Cosa offriamo:


Un gruppo motivato, al lavoro sul progetto di sviluppo di un marchio storico
Profonda attenzione al tuo work-life balance
Sistema di welfare aziendale
Sconto dipendenti nei nostri Ristoranti



Come si svolge l’iter di selezione:


Visioneremo il tuo cv e la lettera di presentazione;
Se la tua candidatura risulterà in linea con le nostre aspettative, l’Ufficio Risorse Umane ti contatterà per fissare un primo incontro.



Qualora il tuo profilo non dovesse risultare in linea con le nostre necessità o l’iter di selezione non dovesse concludersi con successo, sarà nostra cura ricontattarti per esigenze future che riterremo potenzialmente interessanti per te.

È possibile inviare la propria candidatura, con autorizzazione al trattamento dei propri dati, in ottemperanza al Regolamento UE 2016/679.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst II
Description:
Job Description

We are seeking a Data Analyst II to join our growing Data organization and help set up our newly formed Revenue Analytics team. The role reports into the Analytics Director and will focus on creating insight to drive the growth of the business, partnering closely with senior commercial stakeholders and their teams.

Supporting commercial stakeholders with high level Casino strategy will be a top priority for this analyst, as well as providing ongoing analysis and recommendations to stakeholders.

Responsibilities


Develop a strong understanding of Fanatics Betting and Gaming, as well as related products and operations.
Build strong relationships with internal stakeholders in the Casino Business and become a key voice in driving commercial performance across Casino.
Collaboration with other Analysts and Data Scientists to find solutions to business problems.
Contribute to the development and iterative improvement of the automated promotions strategy for the Casino Business.
Remain current on technology and trends in data analytics and the sports betting & gaming industry.


Experience And Skills


A minimum of 2 years proven experience in an analytics role.
Degree in a relevant field, e.g. Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Engineering, or Computer Science
Strong SQL proficiency.
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools, e.g. Tableau or PowerBI.
Experience in solving complex commercial problems using advanced data analytics approaches, with a strong understanding of statistics concepts such as multivariate testing and outlier handling.
Previous experience with a statistical programming language is a plus - e.g. R or Python.
Demonstrated ability to partner closely with stakeholders, earning trust and prioritizing relationships.
Customer focused; highly outcome-oriented and data-driven; experienced in working in high-growth environments.
Logical and analytical approach to problem solving, with strong organizational and communication skills.
Previous experience in the betting and gaming industry is a significant plus.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Satispay

Satispay was born to revolutionise everyday payments – making them simple, fair, and accessible to everyone. Now, the focus has moved even further, aiming to shape the future of money.

We're a movement empowering millions of people, driven by a shared purpose to tackle big challenges. And we're just getting started. We move quickly, think boldly, and trust each other to challenge the norm, learning and growing as we go.

If you're looking for more than just your next job – if you want to build something impactful with a talented team – you're in the right place.

What You’ll Be Doing

As a Data Analyst, you’ll play a key role in enhancing our data-driven decision-making and optimizing product and business processes by researching, analyzing, and visualizing data to drive impactful solutions. Here’s what your day-to-day will look like:


Drive impact – By researching and implementing rigorous data-driven solutions that bring concrete value to product and business lines.
Analyze data – To interpret datasets, derive actionable insights, and support critical decision-making processes across various teams.
Design experiments – To develop and manage A/B tests that optimize and guide product and process enhancements based on measurable results.
Create visualisations – To track key metrics and assist in the creation of visual representations (dashboards, maps) for effective communication of analytical insights to stakeholders.
Manage analytic solutions – By modernizing, standardizing, troubleshooting, and maintaining existing tools to ensure accuracy and reliability of our data infrastructure.


Expect challenges, collaboration, and the freedom to bring your ideas to life. Things change quickly here, so be ready to adapt, take initiative, and shape your role as we grow.

Who We’re Looking For

We need a problem-solver with a strong analytical mindset who thrives in a collaborative environment. If you’re detail-oriented and ready to take ownership in a dynamic setting, you’ll fit right in! Does this sound like you?


Relevant experience – 3+ years of experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics, demonstrating a strong understanding of data analysis principles.
Strong analytical skills – With proven analytical, statistical, and quantitative problem-solving skills to tackle complex data challenges.
Technical proficiency – Advanced knowledge of SQL, including query optimization techniques for efficient data retrieval and manipulation.
Programming skills – Extensive knowledge of Python or R for statistical analysis, data manipulation, and automation of analytical tasks.
Data visualization skills – Experience with Looker, Tableau, or similar visualization tools to create insightful and easily understandable data representations.


Don't worry if you don't tick every box. We believe in the power of different viewpoints and strengths. Your unique perspective is important as we build something special. If you're passionate and can make a difference, we truly encourage you to apply.

Our Benefits & Perks

We believe high commitment, effort, and impact deserve to be highly rewarded and supported. That’s why we created Satispay CareAbout, our way of making sure you’re supported in your well-being, growth, and finances:

👨‍👩‍👧 CareAbout health & well-being


Unlimited paid time off
Psychological support & mental health webinars with Serenis
Flexible hybrid working system
Extended parental leave
Childcare leave


📚 CareAbout growth & development


Professional development programmes
Internal mobility program
Language classes with Preply
Internal workshops & training


💰 CareAbout financial support


Stock Option Plan (with additional grants often provided based on performance)
International relocation support
Competitive salary
Flexible Benefit budget
Meal vouchers


Equal-Opportunity Employer

At Satispay, we're proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and inclusion, welcoming individuals of all backgrounds. This opportunity is open to everyone, regardless - for instance - of race, colour, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, and national origin. Join us in a workplace where everyone belongs!

Learn More About Us

Curious if our way of working clicks with yours? Our values and pillars aren’t just fancy words on a page - they really shape everything we do. Explore them here.

Sounds like your kind of place? Awesome!

We’d love to hear your story.


Show more

  • Create visualisations – To track key metrics and assist in the creation of visual representations (dashboards, maps) for effective communication of analytical insights to stakeholders.
  • Manage analytic solutions – By modernizing, standardizing, troubleshooting, and maintaining existing tools to ensure accuracy and reliability of our data infrastructure.

Expect challenges, collaboration, and the freedom to bring your ideas to life. Things change quickly here, so be ready to adapt, take initiative, and shape your role as we grow.

Who We’re Looking For

We need a problem-solver with a strong analytical mindset who thrives in a collaborative environment. If you’re detail-oriented and ready to take ownership in a dynamic setting, you’ll fit right in! Does this sound like you?

  • Relevant experience – 3+ years of experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics, demonstrating a strong understanding of data analysis principles.
  • Strong analytical skills – With proven analytical, statistical, and quantitative problem-solving skills to tackle complex data challenges.
  • Technical proficiency – Advanced knowledge of SQL, including query optimization techniques for efficient data retrieval and manipulation.
  • Programming skills – Extensive knowledge of Python or R for statistical analysis, data manipulation, and automation of analytical tasks.
  • Data visualization skills – Experience with Looker, Tableau, or similar visualization tools to create insightful and easily understandable data representations.

Don't worry if you don't tick every box. We believe in the power of different viewpoints and strengths. Your unique perspective is important as we build something special. If you're passionate and can make a difference, we truly encourage you to apply.

Our Benefits & Perks

We believe high commitment, effort, and impact deserve to be highly rewarded and supported. That’s why we created Satispay CareAbout, our way of making sure you’re supported in your well-being, growth, and finances:

👨‍👩‍👧 CareAbout health & well-being

  • Unlimited paid time off
  • Psychological support & mental health webinars with Serenis
  • Flexible hybrid working system
  • Extended parental leave
  • Childcare leave

📚 CareAbout growth & development

  • Professional development programmes
  • Internal mobility program
  • Language classes with Preply
  • Internal workshops & training

💰 CareAbout financial support

  • Stock Option Plan (with additional grants often provided based on performance)
  • International relocation support
  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible Benefit budget
  • Meal vouchers

Equal-Opportunity Employer

At Satispay, we're proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and inclusion, welcoming individuals of all backgrounds. This opportunity is open to everyone, regardless - for instance - of race, colour, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, and national origin. Join us in a workplace where everyone belongs!

Learn More About Us

Curious if our way of working clicks with yours? Our values and pillars aren’t just fancy words on a page - they really shape everything we do. Explore them here.

Sounds like your kind of place? Awesome!

We’d love to hear your story.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Wix makes it possible for anyone to succeed online. Since 2006, we’ve grown to around 5,300 employees in 22 countries, launched over 40 products, and serve over 282 million users and their visitors worldwide. At Wix, we push you to innovate, evolve in non-traditional ways, and collaborate. We operate in small teams that work closely together at a high level.

Although we’re already industry leaders in web creation and business, our work is nowhere near done. Our goal is to become the main engine of the Internet so we can create a more open web for all.

We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Wix was built around the idea that everyone has the right to be successful, online. This same vision defines us as an employer: creating a work environment where everyone is welcome, and anyone has the right to succeed.

Job Description

As a Data Analyst, you’ll help us understand how users engage with our Referrals, Loyalty, and Members Area products. You’ll work closely with product managers, designers, and data engineers to surface insights, measure performance, and shape strategy.

We’re also modernizing our workflows by integrating LLM-based tools to automate repetitive tasks, speed up analysis, and communicate insights more efficiently. You’ll help drive the adoption and evolution of these tools as part of our broader data strategy.


Analyze user behavior to uncover trends, identify opportunities, and measure product performance
Collaborate with product, UX, and engineering teams to support data-driven decisions
Design and evaluate A/B tests to guide product improvements
Build clear, actionable reports and dashboards for stakeholders
Leverage LLM-powered tools to streamline and scale data workflows



Qualifications


3+ years experience in data analysis (product, marketing, or web analytics)
Strong skills in SQL and Python
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
Ability to translate complex data into clear insights and recommendations
Familiarity with A/B testing, retention metrics, and funnel analysis
Interest or experience using LLM-based tools (e.g., Claude, ChatGPT, AI copilots)



Additional Information

The Data Analytics team at BeAces is a diverse group of analysts supporting products like Blog, Forms, Emails, and more. As part of this team, you'll focus specifically on Referrals, Loyalty, and Members Area products. You’ll be a member of the BeAces Business Analyst Guild, a collaborative community of analysts focused on data analysis, uncovering insights, and supporting product growth across the company. This balance allows you to collaborate with fellow analysts while working closely with your product team to deliver impactful, data-informed strategies.

We offer:


Equity (RSUs) and discount stock purchasing plans (ESPP)
Health and personal accident insurance
Daily lunch and snacks at the office
Commuting allowance
Discounted phone operator services and compensation for a new phone
Free exercise classes and wellness activities
Online courses and professional development
Fun activities and team events



Salary range is 3000 - 4500 Eur GROSS / month (Total package, including equity)

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
En Amazing Agency estamos buscando una persona curiosa, meticulosa y con ganas de aprender para unirse al equipo de Advisory como Junior Data Analyst. Formarás parte del área de datos, trabajando mano a mano con perfiles de negocio, estrategia y tecnología, y tendrás un rol clave en la construcción de análisis que generan impacto real en la toma de decisiones de nuestros clientes.




¿Qué harás en tu día a día?




Extraer, transformar y analizar datos de múltiples fuentes (Amazon, e-commerce, herramientas internas…).
Identificar patrones, oportunidades o desviaciones relevantes en el negocio de nuestros clientes.
Crear dashboards e informes periódicos y ad hoc.
Colaborar con otros equipos (Accounts, Creatividad, Tech) para conectar los datos con decisiones estratégicas.
Participar en la mejora continua de nuestros procesos de reporting y análisis.




¿Qué buscamos?




Formación en ADE, Ingeniería, Matemáticas, Estadística, Business Analytics o similar.
Nivel alto de Excel y PowerPoint
Conocimientos básicos de SQL y Python, o muchas ganas de aprender.
Familiaridad con herramientas de visualización como Looker Studio, Power BI o Tableau.
Capacidad analítica, atención al detalle y pensamiento crítico.
Actitud proactiva, con ganas de crecer, proponer y aprender rápido.
Experiencia mínima de 1 año en un rol similar, ya sea en empresa, consultoría o agencia.




 En nuestro equipo compartimos estos valores:




People always come first → Las personas están siempre en el centro.
We consider ourselves “builders” → Nos gusta construir, no solo ejecutar.
Natives of the VUCA World → Sabemos movernos bien en entornos inciertos.
Do what is right, not what is easy → Hacemos lo correcto, aunque cueste más.




¿Qué ofrecemos?




Un equipo joven, dinámico y en crecimiento.
Formación constante y acompañamiento para tu desarrollo profesional.
Proyectos con clientes líderes y marcas innovadoras.
Acceso a herramientas punteras y procesos bien definidos.
Posibilidades reales de evolución dentro del área de datos, estrategia o tecnología.




¿Te gustaría formar parte de un equipo donde tus ideas cuentan desde el primer día? Si te motiva un proyecto donde puedas crecer, aprender, proponer y divertirte trabajando, escríbenos o aplica directamente. 

Queremos conocerte.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description

We are looking for a curious and detail-oriented Data Analyst to transform complex datasets into actionable insights. The role involves close collaboration with business teams and clients to define KPIs, identify operational challenges, and explore opportunities for digital solutions. The insights generated will support product decisions, measure outcomes, and validate strategic initiatives across the organization and client base.




Responsibilities

Translate business needs into datasets and analytical models
Conduct use-case-driven analysis to support decision-making and product development
Provide analytical support and improvements for existing client and internal solutions
Define KPIs and create performance tracking tools in collaboration with stakeholders
Build dashboards and visualizations in Power BI using curated Databricks Delta tables
Identify trends and root causes in supply chain, customer operations, and commercial data
Support data modeling and enrichment in partnership with engineers and scientists




Requirements

2+ years of experience in data analysis, ideally in logistics, pharma, or supply chain
Strong SQL skills and proficiency with data visualization tools (Power BI preferred)
Ability to navigate large datasets and perform complex joins
Familiarity with modern data platforms (Azure; Databricks is a plus)
Strong communication skills and high attention to data quality
Fluent in English; French, German, or Spanish are a plus




Additional information

Type: Contract (B2B)
Start date: ASAP
Duration: 6 months + extension possible
Location: Remote (occasional travel, 2 times/year to Paris or Eindhoven)
Workload: Full-time
Show more

Title: Digital Analyst
Description:
En Carrefour España estamos buscando incorporar un Analista Digital especializado en la recolección y gestión de datos dentro del entorno Google. El rol se centrará en implementar,

mantener y optimizar las soluciones de medición digital (principalmente Google Analytics 4 y Google Tag Manager) para garantizar la captura de datos precisos, completos y relevantes. El objetivo es proporcionar una base sólida para el análisis, la generación de insights y la toma de decisiones informadas en las áreas de marketing, producto y experiencia de usuario.




Las principales responsabilidades serán:




● Implementar y configurar Google Analytics 4 (GA4) y Google Tag Manager (GTM) para sitios web y aplicaciones, asegurando una medición precisa del comportamiento del usuario y el rendimiento de las campañas.

● Administrar y mantener las integraciones de GA4 con otras plataformas de Google (Google Ads, Google Marketing Platform) y herramientas de terceros.

● Colaborar con los equipos de marketing, producto y desarrollo para entender sus necesidades de medición y traducir esas necesidades en soluciones técnicas en GA4 y GTM.

● Mantenerse actualizado sobre las últimas tendencias y mejores prácticas en medición digital, especialmente en el ecosistema Google.




Se requiere:




● Conocimiento y experiencia en Google Analytics 4 (GA4) y Google Tag Manager (GTM).

● Experiencia en la implementación de estrategias de etiquetado (tagging) avanzadas.

● Conocimientos avanzados de JavaScript y HTML para la personalización de etiquetas en GTM.

● Experiencia en la integración de GA4 con otras plataformas de Google (Google Ads, Google Marketing Platform).

● Comprensión de los principios de privacidad de datos y las regulaciones (GDPR).

● Gestión y validación del dato en entorno GCP (BigQuery): trabajo en SQL.

● Herramientas de visualización de datos: Looker Studio (necesario), Tableau (deseable).

● Habilidades de resolución de problemas y atención al detalle.

● Capacidad para trabajar en equipo y comunicarse eficazmente con stakeholders técnicos y no técnicos.

● Alta capacidad de aprendizaje y adaptación al cambio.

● Experiencia de, al menos, 2 años.




Se valorará positivamente la experiencia en:




● Conocimientos de lenguajes de programación (Python) para el análisis de datos.

● Experiencia con plataformas de gestión de consentimiento (CMP).

● Inglés (nivel intermedio o avanzado).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a data enthusiast with a passion for uncovering hidden insights? Do you thrive in solving complex problems and want to make an impact? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you!

My name is Camilla Sternberg, Head of Data & Analytics Delivery for TV & Revenue Assurance at Telia Company and today we're looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our Revenue Assurance Analytics team. Your analytical skills will play a vital role in safeguarding Telia Company revenue streams and driving our success. Ready to make a difference? Apply now and embark on an exciting career journey with us!

Telia Company are committed to delivering exceptional telecommunications services. Our Revenue Assurance Analytics team plays a crucial role in ensuring the accuracy and integrity of our revenue streams providing financial accuracy and operational efficiency.

As a Data Analyst you will…

As a Data Analyst in the Revenue Assurance Analytics team, you will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting complex data sets to identify discrepancies, optimize revenue processes, and support strategic decision-making. Your insights will directly contribute to the financial health and success of our organization across our Nordic and Baltic business.

You will be working in a cross-functional team tightly integrated with our Revenue Assurance specialists. Collaborate with them and IT to understand the different processes and how different systems interact with each other to provide services to our customers. Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies related to revenue assurance processes. Ensure data accuracy and integrity through regular audits and validation checks. Collaborate with Revenue Assurance specialists to investigate and resolve revenue discrepancies. Provide actionable insights and recommendations to improve revenue processes and controls. Support the implementation of data-driven strategies to enhance revenue assurance practices.

Who We’re Looking For

You are independent with a strong drive, yet a team player who appreciates an inclusive team environment. You have a proven track record in data analysis, where your unique blend of analytical, technical, and business skills has created value. Specifically, you have proven experience as a Data Analyst with several success stories to share. Your strong analytical skills enable you to interpret complex data sets and work with various databases while effectively managing data from multiple sources. Proven experience in data analysis tools and software such as SQL (Python nice to have) and have experience with data visualization tools like Qlik Sense, Tableau or Power BI or similar. Your curious and proactive mindset drives you to raise and test hypotheses to uncover insights. You have excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and strong communication and collaboration abilities. You can initiate, drive, and adapt to change in a dynamic environment.

For applicants in Lithuania: The range of monthly salary for this position is from 3 908 (Eur) gross to 5 863 (Eur) gross.

We are more than a workplace

Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn a bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.

Ready to make better happen?

We´re looking forward to your application by 25/08/2025. Please apply through our recruitment system to keep your data safe, as we can’t accept resumes via email. Required background checks will be performed.

Got questions? Please reach out to Camilla Sternberg at Camilla.Sternberg@teliacompany.com

Join us and let’s make better happen – together!

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Desarrolla tus competencias como Data Analytics para un gran proyecto de gran impacto en el sector de la seguridad.




En ALTEN tenemos claro que el éxito de nuestros proyectos se debe a las personas que forman nuestro equipo. Por eso, si tienes experiencia como Data Analytics con QA, nos comprometemos a impulsar tu talento, satisfacer tus expectativas laborales y hacerte sentir como en casa. ¿Te unes a nuestro #WelcomeHome? ¡Sigue leyendo!




¿Cuáles serían tus funciones?




Revisar auditorías técnicas y evaluaciones de calidad para detectar desviaciones o no conformidades en datos y procesos.
Evaluar el cumplimiento de estándares técnicos y normativos aplicables a los datos e instalaciones.
Investigar causas raíz de problemas relacionados con la calidad de datos y procesos usando metodologías como 8D, 5 Porqués o Diagrama de Ishikawa.
Diseñar, proponer y seguir la implementación de acciones correctivas y preventivas para mejorar la calidad de los datos y procesos técnicos.
Elaborar informes claros, visuales y detallados usando herramientas como PowerPoint, Power BI y Excel.
Presentar resultados y recomendaciones a equipos locales e internacionales.
Colaborar con otros departamentos para asegurar la calidad y mejora continua de los datos y procesos.




¿Qué buscamos?




Experiencia mínima de 2 años en roles de aseguramiento de calidad, análisis técnico o QA Data, con fuerte capacidad analítica.
Titulación universitaria en áreas relacionadas con Ciencia de Datos, Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería (Industrial, Electrónica, Telecomunicaciones) o afines.
Perfil orientado a resultados, metódico y con habilidades para resolver problemas complejos.
Disponibilidad para participar en reuniones internacionales.
Valorable formación en visualización de datos y storytelling con datos.




¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?




Modalidad Hibrida, (2 días teletrabajo)
Formar parte de una gran empresa competitiva y en continuo crecimiento.
Integración en un equipo de profesionales altamente cualificado, con un buen clima laboral, innovador y dinámico.
Formación especializada y desarrollo profesional continuo.
Beneficios sociales y plan de compensación flexible.
Retribución competitiva.




¿Quiénes somos?




Somos un equipo. Formamos parte de ALTEN, una multinacional europea especializada en proporcionar servicios de consultoría, tecnología de la información y servicios de ingeniería a las principales compañías del mercado español.




Si te gustan las cifras, te diremos que en España tenemos una facturación de 337 millones de euros, 10 sedes y un equipo formado por 5.500 personas.




Además, en ALTEN nos enorgullecemos de ofrecer igualdad de oportunidades con independencia de género, edad, diversidad de capacidades o país de origen. Nuestro compromiso está con el talento y con las personas que lo tienen.

Show more
HTML:
Desarrolla tus competencias como Data Analytics para un gran proyecto de gran impacto en el sector de la seguridad.


En ALTEN tenemos claro que el éxito de nuestros proyectos se debe a las personas que forman nuestro equipo. Por eso, si tienes experiencia como Data Analytics con QA, nos comprometemos a impulsar tu talento, satisfacer tus expectativas laborales y hacerte sentir como en casa. ¿Te unes a nuestro #WelcomeHome? ¡Sigue leyendo!


¿Cuáles serían tus funciones?


  • Revisar auditorías técnicas y evaluaciones de calidad para detectar desviaciones o no conformidades en datos y procesos.
  • Evaluar el cumplimiento de estándares técnicos y normativos aplicables a los datos e instalaciones.
  • Investigar causas raíz de problemas relacionados con la calidad de datos y procesos usando metodologías como 8D, 5 Porqués o Diagrama de Ishikawa.
  • Diseñar, proponer y seguir la implementación de acciones correctivas y preventivas para mejorar la calidad de los datos y procesos técnicos.
  • Elaborar informes claros, visuales y detallados usando herramientas como PowerPoint, Power BI y Excel.
  • Presentar resultados y recomendaciones a equipos locales e internacionales.
  • Colaborar con otros departamentos para asegurar la calidad y mejora continua de los datos y procesos.


¿Qué buscamos?


  • Experiencia mínima de 2 años en roles de aseguramiento de calidad, análisis técnico o QA Data, con fuerte capacidad analítica.
  • Titulación universitaria en áreas relacionadas con Ciencia de Datos, Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería (Industrial, Electrónica, Telecomunicaciones) o afines.
  • Perfil orientado a resultados, metódico y con habilidades para resolver problemas complejos.
  • Disponibilidad para participar en reuniones internacionales.
  • Valorable formación en visualización de datos y storytelling con datos.


¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?


  • Modalidad Hibrida, (2 días teletrabajo)
  • Formar parte de una gran empresa competitiva y en continuo crecimiento.
  • Integración en un equipo de profesionales altamente cualificado, con un buen clima laboral, innovador y dinámico.
  • Formación especializada y desarrollo profesional continuo.
  • Beneficios sociales y plan de compensación flexible.
  • Retribución competitiva.


¿Quiénes somos?


Somos un equipo. Formamos parte de ALTEN, una multinacional europea especializada en proporcionar servicios de consultoría, tecnología de la información y servicios de ingeniería a las principales compañías del mercado español.


Si te gustan las cifras, te diremos que en España tenemos una facturación de 337 millones de euros, 10 sedes y un equipo formado por 5.500 personas.


Además, en ALTEN nos enorgullecemos de ofrecer igualdad de oportunidades con independencia de género, edad, diversidad de capacidades o país de origen. Nuestro compromiso está con el talento y con las personas que lo tienen.

Title: Data Analyst F/H
Description:
Vous évoluez dans le domaine de la Data et souhaitez intégrer un leader de la transformation numérique spécialisé dans les secteurs de la Banque, du Luxe, de l'Assurance, de la Finance, de l'Energie et la possibilité d'évoluer au sein du Groupe Docaposte !

Softeam est labellisé "HappyIndex® AtWork " 2022 pour la 5ème année consécutive !




Nos collaborateurs travaillent en « mode projet » et accompagnent de bout en bout nos clients sur des problématiques de Gouvernance.




CE QUE NOUS RECHERCHONS

Data Analyst pour intervenir sur nos projets et contribuer au développement de notre Practice « Augmented analytics »




CE QUE NOUS ATTENDONS DE VOUS

Vos missions :




Maîtriser les outils statistiques et les informations nécessaires à la mise en place d'une base de données,
Gérer parfaitement les différentes technologies spécifiques au big data,
Extraire les données du système source,
Extraire et traduire des données business en données statistiques,
Modéliser et assurer les mises à jour régulières de la base de données,
Contrôler la qualité des données,
Mettre en œuvre une data warehouse
Synthétiser et vulgariser les informations pour les rendre accessibles aux utilisateurs.










VOUS ETES

Ingénieur(e) de formation avec une spécialité Business Analytics, Big Data, Applications des Masses de Données (IAMD), Systèmes Décisionnels..
vous disposez d'une expérience de 3 ans minimum en tant que Data Analyst/Data Miner..
Vous avez une expertise sur un ou plusieurs des outils d'alimentation et de traitement suivants : SQL, Alteryx, Dataiku, Python..
Vous avez une expertise sur un ou plusieurs des outils de data visualisation suivants : Power BI, Looker/GCP, Qlik, Tableau Software,
Bon(ne) communicant(e), curieux(se) et adaptable, vous êtes doté(e) d'une grande capacité d’analyse et de synthèse et d'un bon esprit d'équipe,
Votre maîtrise de l'anglais vous permet d'évoluer dans un contexte international.










NOUS VOUS OFFRONS

Des missions engageantes auprès des grands acteurs du marché.
Un management de proximité avec Gilles SALVADOR, Directeur du Centre d'Expertise Data, toujours bienveillant et à à l'écoute et avec qui vous pourrez échanger au quotidien sur les enjeux de votre mission et évoquer vos futurs projets afin que nous puissions vous aider à les réaliser.
La possibilité d’évoluer et de monter en compétences grâce à des formations et à des certifications auprès de nos clients et de nos consultants, des 12@13, notre Entité Softeam Institute, Organisme de formation interne de renommé qui délivre des formations auprès de nos clients...

QUI SOMMES-NOUS ?

SOFTEAM DATA est une marque de DOCAPOSTE spécialisée dans l'informatique décisionnelle et les nouvelles technologies. Nous apportons notre expertise à nos clients, principalement des Grands Comptes de la place financière française, dans des projets de transformation digitale et cognitive.
2000 Softeamien.nes sont dédié.es à la transformation métier et digitale de nos clients et ont généré 200 M€ de chiffre d’affaires en 2020.

SOFTEAM SPIRIT

Des communautés d'expertises sur les sujets de la Data
De super nouveaux locaux qui sont en plus accessibles facilement
Une école de formation intégrée
Des évènements : des soirées avec les consultants, des 12@13...
Une entreprise labellisée "Happy at Work" pour la 5ème année consécutive.

N’attendez plus, rejoignez SOFTEAM et venez nous rencontrer dans nos nouveaux locaux situés à la Défense #DevenezSofteamien !

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Line Manager: Els Wets

Business Unit: EBU

Band: 3

Join Our Team as a Data Analyst!

Are you passionate about transforming complex data into actionable insights? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where your analytical skills can directly influence strategic decisions? We’re looking for a talented Data Analyst to play a key role in empowering our B2B stakeholders and management within the EBU department.

Your Mission

As a Data Analyst, you will be the driving force behind turning raw data into meaningful stories that support decision-making. Your insights will help shape our commercial strategies and optimize performance.

What You’ll Do


Design, develop, and maintain dashboards that provide real-time monitoring of our commercial performance, enabling quick and informed decisions.
Respond to business analytics requests by understanding the “Why” behind each inquiry, translating needs into precise data requirements.
Analyze large datasets using appropriate statistical methods and models, uncovering trends and insights.
Create compelling reports and visualizations to communicate findings clearly to internal teams.
Engage in data cleaning, validation, and exploratory analysis to ensure data quality and reliability.
Explain analytical results to stakeholders and facilitate data-driven decision-making.
Enhance our Power BI environment, develop data marts, and automate recurrent reports to improve efficiency.
Collaborate with data engineers and governance teams to improve data quality and ensure timely data updates.
Innovate by suggesting new analysis techniques and visualization methods, fostering a data-driven culture across the company.
Proven experience in data analysis, preferably within a B2B context.
Strong skills in Power BI, SQL, and statistical analysis tools.
Ability to interpret complex data and communicate insights effectively.
A proactive mindset with a passion for continuous improvement and innovation.


Be part of a forward-thinking team where your work directly impacts business success. We offer a collaborative environment, opportunities for growth, and the chance to shape the future of data-driven decision-making in our organization.

Ready to make an impact?

Apply now and help us turn data into our most valuable asset!

Title: Data Analyst Comercial
Description:
🌍 Movistar Prosegur Alarmas resulta de la unión de Movistar, referente tecnológico en el mercado de las telecomunicaciones, y Prosegur Alarmas, experto en seguridad. Somos una propuesta única y pionera que une la seguridad física con la conectividad y la conexión segura, para garantizar que las personas se sientan seguras y ayudarles a vivir una vida más plena y tranquila.




Dentro del equipo de soporte de ventas, queremos incorporar un Data Analyst, que se encargue de la definición, elaboración, seguimiento e interpretación de los informes para dar soporte a los distintos departamentos dentro del área comercial.

Buscamos un profesional con marcada mentalidad analítica, enfocado en el detalle y con capacidad para trabajar en varios proyectos de manera simultánea gestionando los tiempos de entrega.

¡Si es tu perfil, apúntate a nuestra oferta!

¿Qué responsabilidades va a tener?

Contribución a la toma de decisiones relacionadas con el área comercial aportando la información necesaria.
Desarrollo de análisis a medida solicitados por el Comité de Dirección
Definición, diseño y desarrollo de KPIs e Informes de Seguimiento.
Elaboración y mantenimiento de informes periódicos y cuadros de mando.
Coordinación con el resto de departamentos para asegurar la correcta interpretación de la información y detectar posibles inconsistencias en los datos.
Gestión de las peticiones y nuevos desarrollos solicitados a las áreas de BI e IT relacionados con el área.
Participación en el diseño y la implementación de modelos predictivos.

¿Qué perfil estamos buscando?

Formación Universitaria en Matemáticas, Estadística, ADE, Ingeniería o similar.
Mínimo de 2 años de experiencia en posiciones relacionadas.
Elevada Experiencia en el manejo de SAP Business Objects.
Experto en el manejo de Excel.
Conocimientos de SQL.
Experiencia en el manejo de Power BI.
Conocimientos de Power Point.

¿Qué vamos a valorar?

Formación complementaria de posgrado en Análisis de Datos.
Conocimientos de Salesforce
Capacidad de trabajo en equipo y de gestionar varios proyectos de forma simultánea.
Capacidad analítica, con mucho foco en el detalle.

¿Qué ofrecemos?

Contrato indefinido.
Salario según Valía del candidato: Fijo + variable
Formato Híbrido de teletrabajo.
Trabajar en un entorno dinámico con un excelente ambiente laboral
Participar en proyectos estratégicos y disruptivos
Crecer profesionalmente atendiendo a un plan carrera personalizado
Disponer de flexibilidad horaria y de interesantes beneficios sociales
Disfrutar de nuestro Programa Global de Bienestar
Colaborar con nuestra Fundación para crear una sociedad más justa.




Si quieres formar parte del equipo de Movistar Prosegur Alarmas ¡aplica a esta vacante para comenzar tu aventura con nosotros! Estamos deseando conocerte.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities include collecting and analyzing requirements, analyzing data, building data pipelines to load and transform data, measuring data quality, doing code reviews and mentoring junior team members.

Qualifications (required)

Strong experience on SQL and relational databases
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong data modelling experience
Strong experience with Python and Spark
Experience working with data analytics/visualization software.
Experience working in Unix environments
Experience working directly with data consumers to fulfill their needs
Strong networking and collaboration skills
Ability to work independently
Experience navigating large/complex IT environments and infrastructure

Qualifications (nice to have)

Knowledge of the ServiceNow platform
Experience with Agile/DevOps
Knowledge of data governance concepts
Knowledge of data center and IT inventory equipment
Experience working on IT Inventory systems

The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users.

Responsibilities

Understand the day-to-day issues that our business faces, which can be better understood with data
Compile and analyze data related to business' issues
Develop clear visualizations to convey complicated data in a straightforward fashion




Qualifications




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics or Applied Mathematics or equivalent experience
1 - 2 years' Data Analysis experience
Proficient in SQL

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics or Applied Mathematics or equivalent experience

  • Proficient in SQL

Title: Data Analyst - Intern (Remote Internship - Data Analysis)
Description:
This is a remote position.

Delve into the dynamic world of data analysis with an exclusive internship opportunity offered by Kreativstorm, a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm based in Berlin, Germany. Work remotely with our multinational team and unlock your career aspirations in data analysis!


If you're passionate about data analysis and equipped with problem-solving skills, this internship is perfect for you. Under the guidance of industry experts, you'll tackle diverse data analysis projects, exploring concepts like data visualization, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and data mining. Gain hands-on experience in uncovering insights and informing decisions, all from the comfort of your home.





Internship Overview and Details:


Location: Fully remote


Schedule: Full-time internship





Ideal Candidates:


Students pursuing a degree or recent graduates in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.

Aspiring data analysts keen on unraveling complex datasets and extracting meaningful insights.

Analytical thinkers adept at translating data into actionable recommendations.

Effective communicators who thrive in collaborative team settings.

Detail-oriented individuals excelling in fast-paced, analytical environments.

Enthusiastic learners committed to honing their skills in data analysis.

Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., Python, R, SQL) highly valued.

Familiarity with statistical techniques, data visualization, and database management advantageous.

Some initial industry experience is a big plus.



Your Contribution:


Contribute to data collection, cleaning, and analysis processes.

Collaborate with the data analysis team to develop analytical models and insights.

Aid in interpreting data trends and patterns to inform strategic decision-making.

Bring fresh perspectives and innovative solutions to tackle data challenges.

Foster a collaborative team environment focused on excellence in data analysis.

Assist in documenting and presenting analysis results and recommendations.


Why Join Us?


Kreativstorm is a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Our team of experienced consultants brings a diverse range of talents and backgrounds, allowing us to provide tailored solutions to businesses of all sizes and industries. As part of the Yes Network Group, LLC, a reputable US holding company, we have access to extensive resources and expertise. Join us and start your journey in data analysis today!


Apply now and pave the way for your future in data analysis!


Show more

Kreativstorm is a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Our team of experienced consultants brings a diverse range of talents and backgrounds, allowing us to provide tailored solutions to businesses of all sizes and industries. As part of the Yes Network Group, LLC, a reputable US holding company, we have access to extensive resources and expertise. Join us and start your journey in data analysis today!

Apply now and pave the way for your future in data analysis!

Title: Analyst
Description:
Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today, our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity, and driven by responsibility. We’re optimists for change, helping clients initiate, navigate, and benefit from transformation. Optimism is our force multiplier, mitigating downside and maximizing opportunity. With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our +3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results; our optimism transforms outcomes.





Job Description



Collecting, analyzing, and structuring information to support projects.



Personal & professional growth



Works on personal growth and learns the intricacies of the profession and sector by being curious and showing interest
Shows ownership of tasks, asks for help/questions in time when stuck, and aligns expectations with the project team
Collaborates constructively with colleagues and stakeholders and demonstrates reliability

Client & quality



Supports (senior) consultants in successfully executing projects by:
Collecting information
Analyzing and making this information insightful
Preparing workshops

Sia’s growth



Commerce: Assists in developing commercial opportunities and proposals
Knowledge: Shares acquired knowledge internally

Portfolio: Stays informed about the services and projects delivered by Sia





Qualifications


You have completed your Master’s Degree
You have 0 to 2 years’ experience within a consultancy firm
Sectoral knowledge: Telecom & Tech / Financial Services / Automotive / Life Sciences
Outstanding collaborative team player and good communication skills
Analytical mind, exploring options and able to synthesize into conclusions
Dutch and English communication and presentation skills are mandatory

What do we offer?



Competitive salary with extra advantages: a company car or flexible mobility plan, a clear and structured yearly salary increase and bonuses
Training plan to develop yourself as an expert in your discipline
You have the opportunity to work from home, the client or from our offices in Amsterdam or Maastricht
Working in an international environment which creates opportunities to share knowledge and work together on international projects with colleagues all over the world


Additional Information



We are unable to provide a work permit for this position



Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs. 



Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (Nederlands is vereist)

Amsterdam, Nederland

Tot €45.000 + benefits




Wil jij onderdeel worden van een divers data team dat zich onderscheid op de retail markt doormiddel van een eigen platform? Word de nieuwe data / business analist en sluit je aan bij een snelgroeiend retail – technologie bedijf.




Het bedrijf

Het bedrijf werkt met uiteenlopende retail relaties en voorziet retailers van klantinzichten en oplossingen doormiddel van data. Een snelgroeiend bedrijf met een multidisciplinair team om hard mee aan de slag te gaan aan het platform.




De Rol:

Als Data Analist ga je binnen het bedrijf aan de slag met data inrichting en beheer van een retail-analytics platform, waarbij je een cruciale rol kunt spelen bij business bevorderingen van de klant. Wat meer informatie wat betreft de rol:




Het aanleveren van analyses en inzichten intern en voor de klant
Support bij ad hoc analytische klant aanvragen
Inrichten en beheer van data en data – bronnen
Het opzetten van pipelines, en een bijdrage leveren aan het inrichten van dashboards en data solutions.
Bewaken van data kwaliteit.
Communiceren met retail-klanten ter bevordering van de business.




Expertise

Ervaring met Python, R, SQL, en meer
Uitstekende communicatie vaardigheden
Een innovatieve mindset die bijdragen aan verdere ontwikkelingen binnen het bedrijf
retail ervaring is een plus




The Benefits

Een passend salaris bij ervaring en achtergrond
30 vakantie dagen
Laptop / telefoon vergoeding
Een pensioen regeling




Interesse? Reageer doormiddel van het sturen van je CV via de knop naar Elisabeth Oudman.

Title: Data Analyst / Data Visualization Expert
Description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they are doing!

We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.

Data Analyst / Data Visualization Expert

6 month FTC

Location: Eindhoven (onsite 3 days per week)

Fractal is a strategic AI partner to Fortune 500 companies with a vision to power every human decision in the enterprise. Fractal is building a world where individual choices, freedom, and diversity are the greatest assets. An ecosystem where human imagination is at the heart of every decision. Where no possibility is written off, only challenged to get better. We believe that a true Fractalite is the one who empowers imagination with intelligence. Fractal has been featured as a Great Place to Work by The Economic Times in partnership with the Great Place to Work® Institute and recognized as a ‘Cool Vendor’ and a ‘Vendor to Watch’ by Gartner.

About The Role

As a Data Analyst / Data Visualization Expert you will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets and creating compelling visuals that communicate insights effectively to various stakeholders. Your role will involve both rigorous data analysis and the design of clear, precise, and engaging visualizations.

Key Responsibilities


Conduct thorough data analysis to identify trends, correlations, and patterns within datasets.
Develop impactful data visualizations using tools such as QuickSight, QlikSense, Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs and translate them into actionable insights.
Create dashboards and reports that effectively communicate data findings to technical and non-technical audiences.
Ensure data integrity and quality by continuously auditing and cleansing data.
Work alongside cross-departmental teams to integrate data-driven insights into business strategies.
Provide technical guidance on best practices for data visualization and data storytelling.
Stay informed about the latest trends and techniques in data visualization and analytics.



Qualifications


Bachelor's/Master degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in data analysis and data visualization.
Proficient in using data visualization tools such as QuickSight, QlikSense,Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms.
Strong analytical skills and experience with analytics tools such as SQL, Python, or R.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to convey complex data insights in a simple and impactful way.
Demonstrated ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team environment.
Strong attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy.
Experience with dashboard design and data storytelling.
Preferred: Java engineering experience for data processing and system integration tasks.



If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

Not the right fit? Let us know you're interested in a future opportunity by clicking Introduce Yourself in the top-right corner of the page or create an account to set up email alerts as new job postings become available that meet your interest!
Show more

Title: Tableau Reporting Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, deliver digital marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realise their financial goals and help them to save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agrifinance, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data and to innovate. A FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 23,300 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com.

Job Description

Reporting into GTM Manager you will focus on continuaslly evolving Management Information (MI) that helps improve Sales team performance (for example, deeper understanding of sales pipeline, productivity, win/loss, performance, market dynamics).

Working across products, you will foster an insight-driven culture to build trust in the source of the data and present the insight in a clear and unbiased way, supporting pipeline growth and accuracy.

What You'll Do


Maintain a standardised Management Information (MI) to support user self-service.
Build MI and Aanlytics that can scale across products and clients.
Create new sustainable sales performance MI in Tableau/Power BI.
Design new reports, and build/write them in Tableau/Power BI to give new sales.
Ensure data is of high enough quality to support decision-making.
Review performance by analysing performance against target, and discerning trends, allowing performance to be understood.
Identify areas of opportunity for Sales teams to improve performance, for example through individual/team sales pipeline building, education opportunities to deliver improved sales win rates, and other areas.
Highlight areas of risk and propose mitigation to ensure sales execution.
Lead by example and guide adherence to and understanding of regulatory requirements and


Qualifications

What you'll bring:


Around 3 years of experience in an insight role with exposure to Tableau.
Higher Education Degree in Data Analysis, Statistics, Mathematics or similar.
Fluency in written and verbal English.
Tableau dashboarding and reporting skills.
Knowledge of Power BI.
Salesforce reporting and dashboarding knowledge or certification.
Experience working with large bluechip sales environment.


Additional Information

You will get:


Personal Development - career pathway for professional growth supported by learning and development programs and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials and books.
Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefit package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance, monthly flex allowance and internet coverage, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many other benefits!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in Social responsibility event.
Opportunity for Flexible working hours and Home Office.


Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

This is a hybrid remote/in-office role.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Title: Business Data Analyst (H/F)
Description:
We’re looking for the right candidate to join our Business Data Analyst team and become part of a fast-growing company that is on always on the look for people that will demonstrate they’re able to grow with the company. As the role is our entry level, this is a great entry point for a career path at Lokad, either as a future technical expert or as manager.




We help companies in different verticals (aerospace, automotive, ecommerce…) to forecast and make decisions about their inventory. The vast majority of our clients are based outside of France, mainly in North America and Europe.




As a Business Data Analyst (or Supply Chain Scientist in Lokad's terminology), your role is to make sure our clients get the most from Lokad's technology. The role is a mix between technology, data crunching and supply chain expertise. You will address complex supply chain issues and craft quantitative strategies. Your goal is not only to advise your clients on strategies to adopt, but to craft and execute these strategies on a daily basis while leveraging the data available as much as possible. Your goal is also to keep refining these strategies over time to keep them aligned with the needs of our clients.




At Lokad, you will benefit from the extensive training and coaching of our expert team. You will gain skills in supply chain, predictive analysis and overall quantitative optimization for business. You will learn how to achieve measurable business results grounded on scientific analysis of data.




About one quarter of your time is spent interacting with clients in order to better understand their business (mainly over the phone or by mail, with occasional travels). Note that, in order to benefit from your colleagues expertise, you won't be required to work on the customers' premises.




The rest of your time is spent on data analysis, including manipulating and cleaning data, setting up forecasts, economic optimization, reporting and data vizualisation. In order to do this, you'll learn to use our Differentiable Programming tools and a DSL (Envision) developped by Lokad.




We are looking for candidates with the following skills and qualities:




A strong engineering background.
A keen interest in data and quantitative analysis in general.
Good Excel skills or programming skills (e.g. Python, VBA, SQL, etc.).
Impeccable command of English ( French is optional).
Excellent communication skills and telephone manners.
A well-made head, rather than a well-filled head. We are not looking for someone who is already an expert in supply chain or programming. We’re looking for a fast learner, with an ability to quickly grasp technology and concepts, since our technology is by no means a simple and plug-and-play product. Knowledge or understanding of supply chain would be a bonus, but the ability to quickly assess and grasp a new situation or get a clear picture of how an organization works and what are the pain points is what we are really after.
Candidates must be self-motivated, confident and highly driven to achieve results with a “hands on” attitude.




The role is predominantly office based, although some travel will be occasionally required to customers, partners or events. We are located in the very center of Paris, France (station Chevaleret).

Title: DATA ANALYST - SPECIALISTA EXCEL
Description:
La risorsa verrà inserita all’interno del reparto Pianificazione per potenziamento dell’organico.

In questo ruolo avrai l’opportunità di:


Trasformare dati complessi in analisi chiare e strategiche, fornendo insight preziosi per il business
Monitorare le principali attività aziendali, contribuendo a garantire il raggiungimento degli obiettivi
Analizzare l’andamento del fatturato rispetto all’anno precedente, individuando trend ed opportunità di crescita
Creare e presentare report e presentazioni efficaci, sia per i nostri clienti sia per il management attivo



La figura ricercata dovrà possedere:


Diploma e/o Laurea in ambito economico o simili
Conoscenza approfondita del pacchetto Office
Capacità di elaborazione dati tramite Excel (tabelle pivot, funzioni statistiche, strumenti di analisi, grafici e tabelle dati ecc..)
Capacità di lavorare sia in Team che in Autonomia
Disponibilità Full Time



Fides S.p.A. promuove un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, garantendo pari opportunità di impiego a tutti i candidati qualificati, indipendentemente da origine, sesso, genere, orientamento sessuale o religione.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (Remote) - 1014145311
Description:
We're looking for a Marketing Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

A Little Bit About Us

Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 500 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe.

How you will make a difference:


Measure the performance of marketing campaigns, build ad hoc custom reports, and analyze anomalies and trends
Preparation of analytical reports and dashboards (including visualization) for the marketing team
Creation of Google Sheets scripts to connect data from different reports and Google Sheets
High experience and skill level in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets
Analysis of product & marketing metrics correlation and identification of their drivers
Analysis and identification of user behavior patterns based on product & marketing analytics and forming hypotheses for the marketing team based on these insights
Develop the SKAN measurement approach for Google, Meta and Tiktok
Deeply understand the process of acquisition of users in order to analyze/provide valuable proposals
Manage MMP Tools (Adjust), and provide technical support and troubleshooting for the marketing team, specifically related to app attribution, event tracking, and callback implementations
Analyze performance impact of any product and marketing strategy changes
Cooperate with Marketing and Product teams to actively increase project profitability
Collaborate with the BI department to create and maintain data visualization dashboards


Requirements


Bachelor degree in STEM field or similar
Experience working as Analyst of at least 3 years
Strong knowledge of app attribution tools commonly used in the mobile advertising industry
Strong knowledge of machine learning and statistics techniques
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations
In-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms
Experience working with data visualization tools
Experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase, Meta etc
Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams
Proactive attitude and results-oriented


Benefits

Perks of being one of us


Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
We celebrate all company landmarks


Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you.

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressión and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.
Show more
HTML:
We're looking for a Marketing Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

A Little Bit About Us

Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 500 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe.

How you will make a difference:

  • Measure the performance of marketing campaigns, build ad hoc custom reports, and analyze anomalies and trends
  • Preparation of analytical reports and dashboards (including visualization) for the marketing team
  • Creation of Google Sheets scripts to connect data from different reports and Google Sheets
  • High experience and skill level in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets
  • Analysis of product & marketing metrics correlation and identification of their drivers
  • Analysis and identification of user behavior patterns based on product & marketing analytics and forming hypotheses for the marketing team based on these insights
  • Develop the SKAN measurement approach for Google, Meta and Tiktok
  • Deeply understand the process of acquisition of users in order to analyze/provide valuable proposals
  • Manage MMP Tools (Adjust), and provide technical support and troubleshooting for the marketing team, specifically related to app attribution, event tracking, and callback implementations
  • Analyze performance impact of any product and marketing strategy changes
  • Cooperate with Marketing and Product teams to actively increase project profitability
  • Collaborate with the BI department to create and maintain data visualization dashboards

Requirements

  • Bachelor degree in STEM field or similar
  • Experience working as Analyst of at least 3 years
  • Strong knowledge of app attribution tools commonly used in the mobile advertising industry
  • Strong knowledge of machine learning and statistics techniques
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations
  • In-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms
  • Experience working with data visualization tools
  • Experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase, Meta etc
  • Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams
  • Proactive attitude and results-oriented

Benefits

Perks of being one of us

  • Full-time, permanent contract
  • Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
  • Remote work
  • Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
  • Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
  • Enhanced career path designed just for you
  • External training budget
  • We celebrate all company landmarks

Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you.

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressión and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

Title: Data Analyst (F/H)
Description:
Rejoignez l’Aventure MYTTRA en tant qu’Ingénieur Data Analyst (F/H) !

Vous êtes passionné par l’industrialisation et la structuration technique de données produit ? Vous avez le sens du détail, l’esprit d’équipe et l’envie de contribuer à des projets innovants dans l’industrie pharmaceutique ?

Nous recherchons un Ingénieur Industrialisation pour intégrer un projet stratégique et accompagner le transfert industriel de produits au sein d’un environnement international exigeant.




🔎 VOS MISSIONS :

✔️ Gestion des données techniques : Créer, qualifier et intégrer dans SAP l’ensemble des données relatives aux produits, en lien avec les équipes Data Management et IT.

✔️ Collecte et analyse des résultats de tests : Centraliser les données disponibles et en cours (compatibilité chimique, extractibles…), et élaborer avec le service Qualité un raisonnement basé sur les retours clients terrain.

✔️ Documentation et validation : Rédiger le guide de validation, coordonner sa validation par les parties prenantes internes (Qualité, Développement Produit, Product Management) et assurer sa mise à disposition dans la base documentaire.

✔️ Support transverse : Collaborer étroitement avec les équipes R&D, Qualité et Industrialisation pour garantir la disponibilité des données et documents au moment du lancement produit.




🚀 VOTRE PROFIL :

✅ Expérience : Première expérience obligatoire dans l’industrie pharmaceutique.

✅ Compétences techniques : Maîtrise de SAP et MS Office, connaissances en matériaux plastiques et en procédés bioprocédés.

✅ Conduite de projet : Rigueur, capacité d’analyse, coordination multi-services, aisance rédactionnelle.

✅ Langues : Anglais professionnel.




✨ POURQUOI MYTTRA ?

📌 28 CP/an

📌 2 CP associatifs/an

📌 100 € de pass culturel/an

📌 Prime de fin d'année automatique allant jusqu'à 1 500 € brut

📌 Intéressement

📌 Ticket restaurant (8 €) sans condition d'ancienneté

📌 Frais de déplacement incitatifs

Show more

Title: ANALISTA DE DATOS
Description:
Resumen del rol

El Analista de Datos se encargará de recopilar, procesar y analizar grandes volúmenes de datos para extraer insights que apoyen la toma de decisiones estratégicas.

Responsabilidades


Diseñar y ejecutar consultas en bases de datos.
Crear dashboards y reportes interactivos.
Implementar modelos estadísticos y de machine learning.
Colaborar con equipos de negocio para definir métricas clave.
Asegurar la calidad y consistencia de los datos.


Requisitos


Titulación en Matemáticas, Estadística, Informática o similar.
Experiencia mínima de 2 años en análisis de datos.
Manejo de Python, R y SQL.
Experiencia con herramientas BI (Power BI, Tableau).
Inglés nivel intermedio (B2).


Beneficios


Acceso a cursos de especialización en data science.
Flexibilidad horaria y opción de teletrabajo parcial.
Plan de carrera y mentoría interna.
Seguro médico y dental.
Show more

Title: Impiegato/a Back Office Commerciale
Description:
Manpower Italia

Esperienza pregressa di almeno 4-5 anni in ruoli analoghi; Provenienza dal settore meccanica- metalmeccanica Buona padronanza dei principali strumenti informatici e dei gestionali Precisione, autonomia, spirito collaborativo e ottime doti comunicative Flessibilità e orientamento al problem solving

Assunzione Diretta

acquisti

Posizione aperta: Impiegato/a Back Office Commerciale ? Mercato Italia

Per azienda strutturata e in costante crescita, operante nel settore metalmeccanico e con sede in provincia di Modena, si ricerca un/a Impiegato/a Back Office Commerciale da inserire stabilmente all'interno del team commerciale per potenziamento dell'organico.

‹ La Risorsa Si Occuperà Di


Gestione ordini e anagrafiche clienti del mercato Italia
Inserimento dati e monitoraggio ordini
Supporto al team vendite e interfaccia con la produzione e la logistica;
Attività amministrative e di customer care legate al ciclo dell'ordine


Requisiti Richiesti


Esperienza pregressa di almeno 4-5 anni in ruoli analoghi;
Provenienza dal settore meccanica- metalmeccanica
Buona padronanza dei principali strumenti informatici e dei gestionali
Precisione, autonomia, spirito collaborativo e ottime doti comunicative
Flessibilità e orientamento al problem solving


¼ Inquadramento e Condizioni


Contratto a tempo indeterminato
RAL commisurata all'esperienza
Orario: 8:30 ? 12:30 / 14:00 ? 18:00 con flessibilità in ingresso
Dopo 3 mesi: possibilità di smart working 6 giorni/mese, previo accordo con il responsabile


Sede di lavoro: Modena

Tempo pieno

Settore: Altro

Ruolo: Altro
